histogram.name: Autocomplete.DaysSinceLastUse
histogram.summary: Logged when users select Autocomplete entries in the dropdown, this histogram captures the number of days that have passed since the selected autocomplete entry was last submitted on a website. I.e., the distribution of time between uses of an "active" autocomplete entry.

histogram.name: Autocomplete.Events2
histogram.summary: THIS METRIC IS DEPRECRATED BECAUSE THE SHOWN BUCKET IS INFLATED, USE Autocomplete.Events3 INSTEAD. Autocomplete events which are recorded when the user interacts with suggestions served from Autocomplete. The histogram is recorded when an autocomplete suggestion is shown, selected or deleted.

histogram.name: Autocomplete.Events3
histogram.summary: Autocomplete events which are recorded when the user interacts with suggestions served from Autocomplete. The histogram is recorded when an autocomplete suggestion is shown, selected or deleted.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ablation.FillDurationSinceInteraction.{FormType}.{Group}
histogram.expired_intentionally: This is for an ablation study that we may want to reactivate at some points in the future.
histogram.summary: Records for time from the first change to an input element (typed or autofilled) on any form of a frame to a form submission. Note that the change could even happen to a different form on the page than the one submitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ablation.FormSubmissionAfterInteraction.{FormType}.{Group}
histogram.expired_intentionally: This is for an ablation study that we may want to reactivate at some points in the future.
histogram.summary: Records whether after changing the value of an input element (typed or autofilled) in a frame, any form on that page is submitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.AcceptedSuggestionDesktopRowViewVisibleEnough
histogram.summary: This metric is emitted by the desktop autofill popup row view just before accepting the suggestion. This indicates that at least 50% of the popup were visible for at least 500ms and serves as a safeguard against quick (and potentially deceptive, which can lead to revealing user's data) accepts. This metric serves as a sanity check for the guarding logic (the number of `false`s is expected to be extremly low) and will be removed with the `kAutofillPopupDontAcceptNonVisibleEnoughSuggestion` feature.

histogram.name: Autofill.Actor.FillSuggestions.{FillingComposition}.Latency
histogram.summary:
Measures the time between the call to FillSuggestions and the execution of the callback. Emitted whenever the callback is executed (which is guaranteed to always happen once for every call).
{FillingComposition}

histogram.name: Autofill.Actor.FillSuggestions.{FillingComposition}.Outcome
histogram.summary:
Measures the outcome of a call to FillSuggestions. Emitted whenever the callback is executed (which is guaranteed to always happen once for every call).
{FillingComposition}

histogram.name: Autofill.Actor.GetSuggestions.Latency
histogram.summary: Measures the time between the call to ActorFormFillingService::GetSuggestions and the execution of the callback. Emitted whenever the callback is executed (which is guaranteed to always happen once for every call).

histogram.name: Autofill.Actor.GetSuggestions.Outcome
histogram.summary: Measures the outcome of a call to ActorFormFillingService::GetSuggestions. Emitted whenever the callback is executed (which is guaranteed to always happen once for every call).

histogram.name: Autofill.AddedNewAddress
histogram.summary: Logs the surface from which the user manually added an address. Emitted every time the user adds an address manually.

histogram.name: Autofill.Address.DisabledReason.PageLoad
histogram.summary: If the pref autofill.profile_enabled is disabled, this metric records the source. Emitted on page load for a page containing forms. The corresponding metric tracking the activation rate of autofill.profile_enabled is Autofill.Address.IsEnabled.PageLoad.

histogram.name: Autofill.Address.DisabledReason.Startup
histogram.summary: If the pref autofill.profile_enabled is disabled, this metric records the source. Emitted on startup. The corresponding metric tracking the activation rate of autofill.profile_enabled is Autofill.Address.IsEnabled.Startup.

histogram.name: Autofill.Address.IsEnabled.Change
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the user explicitly changes the address autofill opt-in status in settings.

histogram.name: Autofill.Address.IsEnabled.PageLoad
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Profile (Address) Autofill is enabled on page load for a page containing forms.

histogram.name: Autofill.Address.IsEnabled.Startup
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Profile (Address) Autofill is enabled when Chrome launches.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressesDeletedForDisuse
histogram.summary: Log the number of kLocalOrSyncable Autofill addresses that were deleted because they have not been used for `kDisusedDataModelDeletionTimeDelta`. Emitted once on browser startup, if the user has at least one address.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressesSettingsPage.VisitReferrer
histogram.summary: Records the entry point (referrer) every time the user visits the 'Addresses' settings page from a tracked entry point. This metric is emitted on navigation to the page, with the enum values distinguishing the entry points (different ways of reaching the page).

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressesSuppressedForDisuse
histogram.summary: The number of address suggestions not shown in the Autofill popup because they have not been used recently enough. Note that suppression only applies when the user has not typed any text into the field. If any text is in the field, all matching addresses are displayed, regardless of how recently they have been used.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressProfileImportCountrySpecificFieldRequirements
histogram.summary: Each country can require different fields (ZIP code, state, city) to exist for an address to be valid. This histogram logs which mandatory fields were missing in a submitted address form.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressProfileImportRequirements
histogram.summary: Logs whether the individual requirements for importing an address profile are met at form submission time.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressProfileImportStatus
histogram.summary: Logs the overall status of a profile import attempt on form submission time.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressSuggestionOnTyping.AddressFieldTypeUsed
histogram.summary: Logged when the users accepts an Autofill on typing suggestion, records the field type used in the suggestion generation.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressSuggestionOnTypingAcceptance.FieldClassication
histogram.summary: Recorded at the acceptance moment, this metric keeps track of whether the field where Autofill on typing suggestion was accepted was classified or not.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressSuggestionOnTypingAcceptance.NumberOfCharactersTyped
histogram.summary: The number of characters a user typed before accepting an address autofill on typing suggestion. Emited every time a user accepts an autofill on typing suggestion.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressSuggestionOnTypingAcceptance.PerFieldType
histogram.summary: During navigation, for each field where an autofill address suggestion on typing is displayed, logs per field type whether the user has accepted it or not.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressSuggestionOnTypingAcceptance.{ClassificationTypes}
histogram.summary: During navigation, for each field where an autofill address suggestion on typing is displayed, logs whether the user has accepted it or not.

variant.name: Any
variant.summary: any of the following

variant.name: Classified
variant.summary: the triggering field where the suggestion was shown was classified

variant.name: Unclassified
variant.summary: the triggering field where the suggestion was shown was not classified

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressSuggestionOnTypingAccepted.DaysSinceLastUse.Profile
histogram.summary: Logged at submission/navigation time, specifies the last time in days a profile that was used to build Autofill on typing suggestions (and later accepted) was accepted before by a previous suggestion (such as a regular address suggestion).

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressSuggestionOnTypingFieldTypeAddedToStrikeDatabase
histogram.summary: Logged when an address on typing suggestion is not accepted for a field type repetitive times, leading this type to the added to the strike database. Emitted during frame destruction.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressSuggestionOnTypingShown.DaysSinceLastUse.Profile
histogram.summary: Logged at submission/navigation time, specifies the last time in days a profile that was used to build Autofill on typing suggestions was accepted before by a previous suggestion (such as a regular address suggestion).

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressTokenVerificationStatusAtProfileUsage.{AddressType}
histogram.summary: For each {AddressType} in a given AutofillProfile, the verification status of the corresponding non-empty type is recorded when a profile is used to fill a form.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.Deduplication.NumberOfLocalEntitiesConsidered.AllEntities
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill AI entities that have been considered for deduplication. Emitted once per major version if there are at least more than two entities of a certain type.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.Deduplication.NumberOfLocalEntitiesConsidered{EntityType}
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill AI {EntityType} entities that have been considered for deduplication. Emitted once per major version if the user has at least two {EntityType} entities.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.Deduplication.NumberOfLocalEntitiesDeduped.AllEntities
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill AI entities that have been deduped. Emitted once per major version only.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.Deduplication.NumberOfLocalEntitiesDeduped{EntityType}
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill AI {EntityType} entities that have been deduped. Emitted once per major version.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.EditedAutofilledFieldAtSubmission
histogram.summary: On submission time, this metric emits for every field that was autofilled with Autofill AI, if the filling was accepted or subsequently corrected.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.EditedAutofilledFieldAtSubmission.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: On submission time, this metric emits for every field that was autofilled with Autofill AI, if the filling was accepted or subsequently corrected, and also split the buckets by the Autofill AI type of the field.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.EntityTable.DecryptStatus2
histogram.summary: Records whether the decryption stage of reading from the EntityTable was successful or not (and in that case whether it was a permanent failure (key was lost or data was corrupted) or a temporary failure (e.g. the decryption service was unavailable). Emitted every time autofill tries to decrypt a value to read/write to the table.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.EntityTable.{EncryptionStage}Status
histogram.summary: Records whether the {EncryptionStage} stage of reading/writing into the EntityTable was successful or not. Emitted every time autofill tries to {EncryptionStage} a value to read/write to the table.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.Funnel.{SubmissionState}.Eligibility2
histogram.summary: Records the EntityType's for which a form is eligible for filling. Emitted once per form submission/abandonment.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.Funnel.{SubmissionState}.{FunnelStage}{EntityGranularity}

variant.name: CorrectionAfterFill
variant.summary: Given a form where the user filled an Autofill AI suggestion, records whether the filling was corrected or not.

variant.name: FillAfterSuggestion
variant.summary: Given a form where the user saw Autofill AI filling suggestions, records whether the suggestion was filled or not.

variant.name: ReadinessAfterEligibility
variant.summary: Given an Autofill-AI-eligible form, this metric records whether the user has stored data to fill the form.

variant.name: SuggestionAfterReadiness
variant.summary: Given an Autofill-AI-eligible form where the user has data stored to fill it, this metric records whether the user saw an Autofill AI suggestion or not.
Emitted for any kind of entities.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.Funnel.{SubmissionState}.{FunnelStage}{EntityGranularity}{EntityRecordType}

variant.name: CorrectionAfterFill
variant.summary: Given a form where the user filled an Autofill AI suggestion, records whether the filling was corrected or not.

variant.name: FillAfterSuggestion
variant.summary: Given a form where the user saw Autofill AI filling suggestions, records whether the suggestion was filled or not.

variant.name: ReadinessAfterEligibility
variant.summary: Given an Autofill-AI-eligible form, this metric records whether the user has stored data to fill the form.

variant.name: SuggestionAfterReadiness
variant.summary: Given an Autofill-AI-eligible form where the user has data stored to fill it, this metric records whether the user saw an Autofill AI suggestion or not.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.KeyMetrics{KeyMetric}{EntityGranularity}

variant.name: .FillingAcceptance
variant.summary: Records, at form submission, and given that the user saw an Autofill AI prompt, whether the user used AutofillAI to fill the form or not.

variant.name: .FillingAssistance
variant.summary: Records, at form submission, whether the user used Autofill AI to fill the form or not.

variant.name: .FillingCorrectness
variant.summary: Records, at form submission, and given that the user filled an Autofill AI suggestion, whether the user manually edited an autofilled field filled by Autofill AI or not.

variant.name: .FillingReadiness
variant.summary: Records, at form submission, whether the user had Autofill AI data to fill the form or not.
Emitted for any kind of entities.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.KeyMetrics{KeyMetric}{EntityGranularity}{EntityRecordType}

variant.name: .FillingAcceptance
variant.summary: Records, at form submission, and given that the user saw an Autofill AI prompt, whether the user used AutofillAI to fill the form or not.

variant.name: .FillingAssistance
variant.summary: Records, at form submission, whether the user used Autofill AI to fill the form or not.

variant.name: .FillingCorrectness
variant.summary: Records, at form submission, and given that the user filled an Autofill AI suggestion, whether the user manually edited an autofilled field filled by Autofill AI or not.

variant.name: .FillingReadiness
variant.summary: Records, at form submission, whether the user had Autofill AI data to fill the form or not.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.ModelExecutionStatus
histogram.summary: Describes the outcome of an AutofillAI (server-side) model run. Recorded whenever the client receives the result of a model execution or the model execution times out.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.NumberOfFilledFields.{FillType}.{SplitCriteria}

variant.name: AutofillAi
variant.summary: Only counts fields filled by Autofill AI and nothing else.

variant.name: Total
variant.summary: Counts fields filled by any Autofill source, except Autocomplete and Compose.

variant.name: .HasDataToFill
variant.summary: Only emitted for users who have some Autofill AI entity saved and can therefore fill using Autofill AI.

variant.name: .NoDataToFill
variant.summary: Only emitted for users with no entities saved.

variant.name: OptedIn
variant.summary: Only emitted for users opted in to Autofill AI.

variant.name: OptedOut
variant.summary: Only emitted for users not opted in to Autofill AI.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.OptIn.Change
histogram.summary: Records changes to the user's opt-in status to Autofill with AI. The recorded value is the opt-in status after the change. Recorded whenever the user explicitly triggers a change to the opt-in status (i.e., during the first run experience or in settings). Not recorded during implicit changes to the effective opt-in status (e.g., if the user signs out or changes their locale).

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.OptIn.Funnel
histogram.summary: Records events related to the surfaces available for users to find out and opt in Autofill AI. These educational surfaces are the IPH and the FFR dialog. Logged when any of them are shown and when the FFR (final step in the funnel) is accepted.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.OptIn.PrefMigration.
histogram.summary: Records the Autofill AI syncable pref migration result, which depends on the its initial value and the account keyed pref. Emitted during startup.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.OptIn.Status.{EmissionStrategy}
histogram.summary:
Records whether the user is opted into the Autofill AI feature or not.
{EmissionStrategy}.

variant.name: Startup
variant.summary: Emitted on startup of the profile.

variant.name: Submission
variant.summary: Emitted each time a form fillable by Autofill AI is submitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.PromptSuppression.{PromptType}{EntityType}
Autofill.Ai.StoredEntitiesCount{EntityType}{RecordType}

variant.summary: Emitted for all entity record types.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.Timing.GetEntityUpstreamCandidateFromSubmittedForm
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds passed between the start and end of the method that returns a local entity candidates to be migrated to the Wallet server. Emitted during form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.WalletContextualSurfacingEnabled
histogram.summary: Records, at browser startup, whether a user has the Wallet setting regarding contextual surfacing enabled or not.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.{PromptType}.AllEntities
histogram.summary: Records events related to the save or update prompt dialog for all entity types. Emitted when the dialog its closed, regardless of whether it was done so by an user action or not.

histogram.name: Autofill.Ai.{PromptType}{EntityType}{RecordType}
histogram.summary:
Records events related to the save or update prompt dialog for each entity type. Emitted when the dialog its closed, regardless of whether it was done so by an user action or not.
{RecordType}

variant.summary: Emitted for all entity record types.

histogram.name: Autofill.AmountExtraction.HeuristicRegexesComponentInstallationResult
histogram.summary: The result from Amount Extraction Heuristic Regexes component installation. This metric is recorded every time when a new regexes version is installed.

histogram.name: Autofill.AmountExtraction.Latency2.{AmountExtractionLatencyResult}
histogram.summary: Records the latency of amount extraction process. This latency is measured from the moment amount extraction is initiated in the browser process to when a response is received. Logged when the search is finished.

variant.name: Failure
variant.summary: Labeled amount extraction latency when amount extraction failed

variant.name: Success
variant.summary: Labeled amount extraction latency when amount extraction succeeded

histogram.name: Autofill.AmountExtraction.Result2
histogram.summary: Records the result of amount extraction process. Amount extraction process is initiated once user clicks on the credit card form on Desktop. The result is recorded upon receiving the response in the browser process or the extraction timeout is reached before a response is received. This metric records three types of amount extraction results: success, amount not found and timeout.

histogram.name: Autofill.AndroidAutofillAvailabilityStatus
histogram.summary: Clank only. Logs whether Android Autofill was available. If not, it splits the reasons why. Only one reason is recorded (e.g. the pref isn't checked if a policy makes it impossible to set the pref). The reasons are not ordered. Emitted only once per cold start of Chrome when the first tab is created.

histogram.name: Autofill.AndroidAutofillManagerErrors
histogram.summary: Clank and WebView only. Logs failures when calling Android Autofill's AutofillManager. All logged failures are caught and silently ignores since they are RuntimeExceptions neither the user nor the browser can affect and may be recoverable with later invocations. This includes but is not limited to timeouts. Emitted for every failed API call. No success metric exists since the call volume is quite high but the expected error volume is not.

histogram.name: Autofill.Autocomplete.NotOff.EditedAutofilledFieldAtSubmission2{AutofillFormType}
Autofill.Autocomplete.NotOff.FillingAcceptance.{FormType}
histogram.summary: Records for each submitted form whether the user accepted the suggestion to fill values and the triggering field has autocomplete != off. This is counted as 'yes' if the user accepted such a suggestion at any time, regardless whether other suggestions were ignored or whether the accepted suggestion was reverted afterwards. {FormType}

histogram.name: Autofill.Autocomplete.Off.EditedAutofilledFieldAtSubmission2{AutofillFormType}
Autofill.Autocomplete.Off.FillingAcceptance.{FormType}
histogram.summary: Records for each submitted form whether the user accepted the suggestion to fill values and the triggering field has autocomplete = off. This is counted as 'yes' if the user accepted such a suggestion at any time, regardless whether other suggestions were ignored or whether the accepted suggestion was reverted afterwards. {FormType}

histogram.name: Autofill.Autocomplete.PredictionCollisionState
histogram.summary: Records a pair of (PredictionState, AutocompleteState) for each field in a submitted form. PredictionState indicates if server and/or heuristic type prediction were available. AutocompleteState indicates if the autocomplete attribute was present and whether it was valid. Emitted on form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.Autocomplete.PredictionCollisionType.Heuristics
histogram.summary: Records the heuristic type of each field with autocomplete=garbage in a submitted form. Emitted on form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.Autocomplete.PredictionCollisionType.Server
histogram.summary: Records the server type of each field with autocomplete=garbage in a submitted form. Emitted on form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.Autocomplete.PredictionCollisionType.ServerOrHeuristics
histogram.summary: Records the server type of each field with autocomplete=garbage in a submitted form. If no server type is available, the heuristics type is logged instead. Emitted on form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.Autocomplete.PredictionCollisionType2.{PredictionType}.{AutocompleteState}
histogram.summary: Records the PredictionType of each field in a submitted form, depending on the field's AutocompleteState. Emitted on form submission.

variant.name: ServerOrHeuristics
variant.summary: If available, the server type. Otherwise the heuristic type.

histogram.name: Autofill.Autocomplete.SingleEntryRemovalMethod
histogram.summary: Records how a user removed a single Autocomplete entry (i.e. via the keyboard or via a delete button in the Autofill popup). Emitted on Autocomplete entry deletion.

histogram.name: Autofill.AutocompleteUnrecognized.FieldFillingStats2
histogram.summary: Records for every field with autocomplete unrecognized, whether it was filled, corrected, manually filled, or left empty. Recorded at submission time.

histogram.name: Autofill.AutofillAi.ModelCache.InitSuccess
histogram.summary: Records initializing the AutofillAI model cache was successful. Recorded when the model cache is created, i.e., at profile creation.

histogram.name: Autofill.AutofillAndPasswordsSettingsPage.VisitReferrer
histogram.summary: Records the entry point (referrer) every time the user visits the 'Autofill and Passwords' settings page from a tracked entry point. This metric is emitted on navigation to the page, with the enum values distinguishing the entry points (different ways of reaching the page).

histogram.name: Autofill.AutomationRate.{FormType}
histogram.summary: Records the percentage of input text field characters that were autofilled. This function measures text input as a number of UTF-16 code points. Fields with more than 150 code points input are ignored. Emitted on form submission. {FormType}

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.CardUnmaskDuration.Fido
histogram.summary: Tracks the time it takes to fetch the full PAN of a credit card once user successfully authenticates using WebAuthn.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.CardUnmaskDuration.Fido.{CardType}.{Result}
histogram.summary: Tracks the time it takes to fetch the full PAN of a credit card once user successfully authenticates using WebAuthn.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.CardUnmaskPreflightCalledWithFidoOptInStatus
histogram.summary:
The total count of this histogram tracks the number of times Chrome made a preflight GetDetailsForGetRealPan call. A preflight call is only made when card suggestions are shown, and can only happen when the user has server cards and is eligible for WebAuthn. For every log in this histogram, it also tracks whether the user is opted-in to WebAuthn or opted-out of WebAuthn. A log of true indicates the user is opted-in, and a log of false indicates the user is opted-out.
As a percentage of the number of times card suggestions are shown, which is tracked under Autofill.FormEvents.CreditCard, this metric provides an estimate for the potential reach for the Autofill Better Auth project. Moreover, this acts as a baseline value for other metrics in this project.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.CardUnmaskPreflightDuration
histogram.summary: Tracking the latency of a GetDetailsForGetRealPan call to Payments servers. This duration should be comparable to that of Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.Duration and should ideally stay under 500 ms in order for the user to autofill their credit card without experiencing much friction.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.CardUnmaskPreflightInitiated
histogram.summary: Logs the number of times that we initiate the card unmask preflight flow. This will log both when the user is eligible for WebAuthn as well as when the user is not eligible for WebAuthn, as it is logged before we check this status.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.CardUnmaskTypeDecision
histogram.summary: If the user is definitely opted-in to the new auth flow, Payments sends a list of instrument IDs in the GDFGRP call, and Chrome makes the final call on whether CVC or WebAuthn should be shown. Tracks which authentication method was prompted.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.EnrollmentPromptOffered
histogram.summary: Records whether the Better Auth (FIDO) enrollment prompt was offered. Logged at the time of showing the prompt, or if not shown, when the prompt would have been shown. This metric can only be logged from the checkout flow, after a CVC authentication has completed.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.FlowEvents.{BetterAuthFlowType}.{CardType}
histogram.summary: Tracks when a user completes each step in a card unmasking flow per authentication flow type, with an additional breakdown for if it was a server card or virtual card.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.FlowEvents{AutofillCreditCardAuthenticationFlows}

variant.name: .Cvc
variant.summary: CVC authentication only

variant.name: .CvcFallbackFromFido
variant.summary: CVC fallback from FIDO authentication

variant.name: .CvcThenFido
variant.summary: CVC followed by FIDO authentication

variant.name: .Fido
variant.summary: FIDO authentication only

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.OptInCalled.FromCheckoutFlow
histogram.summary: Tracks when users opt-in from a checkout flow, making an UpdateAutofillUserPreference call. For each call to payments, logs if the call was made in order to verify an existing credential, to create a new credential, or to fetch a challenge.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.OptInPromoNotOfferedReason
histogram.summary: Records when the Better Auth (FIDO) opt-in promo could have been offered on Desktop, but wasn't. Logged at the time of the promo not being shown. This metric can only be logged from the checkout flow, as we do not block opting in to FIDO from the settings page. It logs the enum reason of what caused the promo to not be shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.OptInPromoShown.FromCheckoutFlow
histogram.summary:
Logs the number of times the opt-in promo to use FIDO authentication for card unmasking has been shown. Only applicable on Desktop.
This is useful when compared to Autofill.BetterAuth.OptInPromoUserDecision, to see what percentage of users are interacting with the dialog. Also, when an opted-out user receives the preflight call before selecting a card (which is recorded by the first bucket in Autofill.BetterAuth.UserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection.OptedOut), then the promo should eventually show if the user selects a masked card and successfully authenticates through CVC.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.OptInPromoUserDecision.FromCheckoutFlow
histogram.summary: Tracks the user response to the opt-in promo for using FIDO authentication for card unmasking. The user can either accept the promo and proceed to perform user-verification, can decline the promo immediately, or first accept the promo but then decline while the challenge is being fetched. Only applicable on Desktop.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.PreflightCallResponseReceivedOnCardSelection.{AutofillFidoAuthenticationEnabledState}.{CardType}
histogram.summary: The GetDetailsForGetRealPan call is made when card suggestions are shown. This metric tracks whether the response is received before or after a card is chosen by the user. For an opted-in user, a late response would imply FIDO registration/authentication for the selected card will not be offered. For an opted-out user, a late response would imply that opt-in may not have been offered. This metric is split by whether the user is opted-out or opted-in, and by the type of card used.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.UserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection.OptedIn.Duration
histogram.summary: The GetDetailsForGetRealPan call is made when card suggestions are shown. This metric logs the duration of the perceived latency when the response for this call is received after a card is chosen by an opted-in user. After waiting a set number of seconds without receiving a response, Chrome will fall back to CVC authentication.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.UserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection.OptedIn.TimedOutCvcFallback
histogram.summary: The GetDetailsForGetRealPan call is made when card suggestions are shown. If an opted-in user selects a card before the response is returned, latency is perceived. Given that the user perceives latency, this metric logs whether the request timed out and fell back to CVC or if the request was completed and continued to WebAuthn.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.UserPerceivedLatencyOnCardSelection.{AutofillFidoAuthenticationEnabledState}
histogram.summary: The GetDetailsForGetRealPan call is made when card suggestions are shown. This metric tracks whether the response is received before or after a card is chosen by the user. For an opted-in user, a late response would imply perceived latency. For an opted-out user, a late response would imply that opt-in may not have been offered. {AutofillFidoAuthenticationEnabledState}

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.UserVerifiabilityCheckDuration
histogram.summary: Tracks how long it takes to check that the user is verifiable through WebAuthn's IsUserVerifiablePlatformAuthenticatorAvailable() call. This check is done before deciding to make a GetDetailsForGetRealPan call to Payments.

histogram.name: Autofill.BetterAuth.WebauthnResult{AutofillFidoUserVerificationFlow}

variant.name: .AuthenticationAfterCVC
variant.summary: WebAuthn after CVC

variant.name: .CheckoutOptIn
variant.summary: Registering for WebAuthn on checkout

variant.name: .ImmediateAuthentication
variant.summary: WebAuthn for card downstream

histogram.name: Autofill.Bnpl.IssuersSyncedCount.Startup
histogram.summary: The number of BNPL issuers that were successfully synced at startup, measured at Chrome profile launch time.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bnpl.PopupWindowLatency.{Issuer}.{Result}
histogram.summary: Logged when the pop-up is closed. Broken down by issuer and result, because each issuer should be looked at separately, and each result should also be looked at separately to understand user behavior better inside of the pop-up flow.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bnpl.PopupWindowResult.{Issuer}
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of the BNPL pop-up window for {Issuer}, i.e. Success, Failure, or NotFinished. Logged once when the pop-up window is closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bnpl.PopupWindowShown.{Issuer}
histogram.summary: The count for the number of times the BNPL popup window for {Issuer} is shown. Records true every time the popup window is shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bnpl.SelectionDialogIssuerSelected
histogram.summary: The count of BNPL issuer selection per issuer. Records when an issuer is selected from the select BNPL issuer dialog.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bnpl.SelectionDialogResult
histogram.summary: The result of the select BNPL issuer Dialog. Records when an action is taken on the dialog.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bnpl.SelectionDialogShown
histogram.summary: The count for the number of times the BNPL Issuer Selection Dialog is shown. Records true every time the dialog is shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bnpl.SuggestionUnavailableReason
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason why a BNPL suggestion was unavailable, i.e. Amount extraction failure or Checkout amount not supported. Logged once per page load when a BNPL suggestion is unavailable on an eligible BNPL merchant's website when suggestions were shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bnpl.TosDialogResult.{Issuer}
histogram.summary: The result of the BNPL ToS Dialog, broken down by result. Records when an action was taken on the dialog.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bnpl.TosDialogShown.{Issuer}
histogram.summary: The count for the number of times the BNPL ToS Dialog is shown for {Issuer}. Records true every time the dialog is shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bubble.HideDueToTabHide
histogram.summary: Records the type of the active bubble that is hidden and moved to the pending queue because its tab was deactivated (moved to the background). Recorded when a tab is about to be hidden.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bubble.Queue.AddedDueToActiveBubble
histogram.summary: Logged when a bubble is added to the queue because another bubble was active. It counts the bubbles that were queued because of a higher priority bubble that is currently showing. This metric is recorded when a bubble requests to show.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bubble.Queue.AddedDueToHover
histogram.summary: Logged when a bubble is added to the queue because the user was hovering over the active bubble. This metric is recorded when a bubble requests to show.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bubble.Queue.Discarded
histogram.summary: Logs the count of bubbles that are not added to the queue because a non-timed-out, non-preemptible bubble of the same type is already pending. This metric is recorded when a bubble requests to show.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bubble.Queue.Replaced
histogram.summary: Logged when a bubble in the queue is replaced by a new bubble of the same type due to the bubble type's immediate preemption policy (e.g., for passwords), not due to a timeout. This metric is recorded once a bubble is hidden and the pending queue of bubbles is cleaned up.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bubble.Queue.ShownFromQueue
histogram.summary: Logs, per bubble type, when a bubble from the queue is shown to the user. This metric is recorded when the bubble is shown after the user acted upon another bubble.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bubble.Queue.ShownFromQueueOnTabVisible
histogram.summary: Logs, per bubble type, when a bubble from the queue is shown to the user when the tab became visible. This metric is recorded when the bubble is shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bubble.Queue.TimedOut
histogram.summary: Logged when a bubble is erased from the queue because it has exceeded its timeout. This can occur during general queue cleanup or when a new bubble of the same type replaces the timed-out one.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bubble.Queue.TimeInQueue.{BubbleType}
histogram.summary: Logged for bubbles from the queue, tracking the time from being queued to being shown for each bubble type when they are shown. This metric is recorded when a bubble is shown from the queue.

variant.name: FilledCardInformation
variant.summary: Filled card information bubble.

variant.name: MandatoryReauth
variant.summary: Mandatory reauth bubble.

variant.name: OfferNotification
variant.summary: Offer notification bubble.

variant.name: Password
variant.summary: Password bubble.

variant.name: SaveIban
variant.summary: Save IBAN bubble.

variant.name: SaveUpdateAddress
variant.summary: Save/update address bubble.

variant.name: SaveUpdateAutofillAi
variant.summary: Save/update Autofill AI data bubble.

variant.name: SaveUpdateCard
variant.summary: Save/update card bubble.

variant.name: VirtualCardEnrollConfirmation
variant.summary: Virtual card enroll confirmation bubble.

variant.name: WalletablePassConsent
variant.summary: Walletable pass consent bubble.

variant.name: WalletablePassSave
variant.summary: Walletable pass save bubble.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bubble.RequestShow
histogram.summary: This metric tracks the count all bubble-show attempts per bubble type. Logged when the bubble requests to show and recorded when a bubble requests to show.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bubble.RequestShow.ForceShow
histogram.summary: This metric tracks the count of all bubble force show attempts bypassing the priority logic of the BubbleManager. Recorded when a bubble requests to show.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bubble.Show.NoActiveBubble
histogram.summary: Logged when the bubble requests to be shown but no other bubble is active, leading to the bubble being shown immediately. This metric tracks the count of bubbles that were directly shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bubble.Show.Preemption
histogram.summary: Logged when a new bubble successfully hides and replaces an active bubble. It tells the count of bubbles that were shown while hiding another actively shown bubble per bubble type.

histogram.name: Autofill.Bubble.WasPreempted
histogram.summary: Records the type of a bubble that was actively showing but was hidden due to preemption by a higher-priority bubble. Recorded at the moment an active bubble is preempted by a new bubble is requested to be shown that has a higher priority or was requested with the force_show flag.

histogram.name: Autofill.CardholderNameFixFlowPrompt.Events
histogram.summary: Events tracking the usage of the cardholder name fix flow prompt. This prompt is triggered whenever cardholder name must be explicitly requested from the user in order to upload the card to Google Payments.

histogram.name: Autofill.CardInfoRetrievalEnrolled.Result
histogram.summary: Logs the result of a card info retrieval enrolled card unmasking process when the unmasking is finished (whether it succeeded or otherwise reason of the failure).

histogram.name: Autofill.CardUnmask.ScreenLockCheckBox.InitialState
histogram.summary: Records the initial state of the ScreenLockCheckBox. The ScreenLockCheckBox is the checkbox shown to the user as part of the CardUnmaskPrompt. This histogram will be logged only when the CardUnmaskPrompt is initialized. This is only available on Android.

histogram.name: Autofill.CardUnmask.ScreenLockCheckBox.UserChecked
histogram.summary: Records the check/uncheck action from users on the ScreenLockCheckBox. The ScreenLockCheckBox is the checkbox shown to the user as part of the CardUnmaskPrompt. This histogram will be updated whenever the user clicks/unclicks the checkbox. This is only available on Android.

histogram.name: Autofill.CardUnmaskAuthenticationSelectionDialog.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of the Card Unmask Authentication Selection Dialog, such as user cancelation before/after selecting a challenge option, or automatic dismissal after a server success/failure for a selected option was returned. The metric is recorded any time the dialog is dismissed.

histogram.name: Autofill.CardUnmaskAuthenticationSelectionDialog.Shown2
histogram.summary: On every show of the card unmask challenge option selection dialog, this histogram records a count (with a maximum of 10) for the number of challenge options that were shown. This dialog is shown when a user needs to select a challenge option to authenticate a card for payments autofill.

histogram.name: Autofill.CardUploadDecisionMetric
histogram.summary: Whether upload was offered upon detecting a form submission with credit card data, a detailed reason if upload was offered even with some missing fields and detailed reasons if it wasn't.

histogram.name: Autofill.CardUploadEnabled2
histogram.summary: Detailed reasons why (or why not) card upload was enabled. When a user submits a form from which a card was extracted, this check is triggered to decide whether to ask the user if they want to upload the card.

histogram.name: Autofill.ConditionalPasskeysFlow.PasskeysState
histogram.summary: Clank only. Logs the state of passkeys in a conditional passkey flow. It could be that the passkeys were not ready, there were no saved passkeys or there were passkeys. Emitted when the CredMan UI was closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCard.DisabledReason.PageLoad
histogram.summary: If the pref autofill.credit_card_enabled is disabled, this metric records the source. Emitted on page load for a page containing forms. The corresponding metric tracking the activation rate of autofill.credit_card_enabled is Autofill.CreditCard.IsEnabled.PageLoad.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCard.DisabledReason.Startup
histogram.summary: If the pref autofill.credit_card_enabled is disabled, this metric records the source. Emitted on browser startup when a new Chrome profile is loaded. The corresponding metric tracking the activation rate of autofill.credit_card_enabled is Autofill.CreditCard.IsEnabled.Startup.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCard.IsEnabled.PageLoad
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Credit Card Autofill is enabled on page load for a page containing forms.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCard.IsEnabled.Startup
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Credit Card Autofill is enabled when Chrome launches.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCard.Seamless{AutofillSeamlessnessFillability}{AutofillSeamlessnessMeasurementTime}{AutofillSeamlessnessVisibility}
histogram.summary:
Records for each credit card form the quality of the fill. {AutofillSeamlessnessFillability} {AutofillSeamlessnessMeasurementTime} {AutofillSeamlessnessVisibility}
The fields in question are: cardholder name (full, or first and last), credit card number, expiration date (MM/YY, MM/YYYY, MM and YY, or MM and YYYY), and CVC.
Each bucket represents a minimal set of fields that must be autofilled. Lower numbers are better:
Bucket 0 = name & number & exp. date & CVC = Full fill :-D
Bucket 1 = number & exp. date & CVC = Optional name missing :-)
Bucket 2 = name & number & exp. date = Optional CVC missing :-)
Bucket 3 = number & exp. date = Optional name and CVC missing :-)
Bucket 4 = name & number & CVC = Full fill but exp. date missing :-|
Bucket 5 = all other scenarios = Partial fill :-(
Any form that contains at least one credit card field counts as credit card form.
Note that the Fillable.AtFillTimeAfterSecurityPolicy variant is not recorded because at the time of recording the available information are not enough to infer this metric.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCard.Seamless{AutofillSeamlessnessFillability}{AutofillSeamlessnessMeasurementTime}{AutofillSeamlessnessVisibility}.Bitmask
histogram.summary:
Records for each credit card form the quality of the fill. {AutofillSeamlessnessFillability} {AutofillSeamlessnessMeasurementTime} {AutofillSeamlessnessVisibility}
The emitted value is a non-zero bitmask whose bits have the following meaning, from highest to lowest bit:
Bit #4 is true iff a cardholder name was filled.
Bit #3 is true iff a card number was filled.
Bit #2 is true iff an expiraton date was filled.
Bit #1 is true iff a CVC name was filled.
Note that the Fillable.AtFillTimeAfterSecurityPolicy variant is not recorded because at the time of recording the available information are not enough to infer this metric.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCard.SelectionLatencySinceShown.CardWithIssuerId.{CardMetadataVisible}.{CardIssuerId}
histogram.summary: The latency between an Autofill credit card suggestion being shown, and when it was selected, in milliseconds. Logged immediately when a card is selected by the user if the card has an issuer id, and it is broken down by whether the selected card has card metadata available. This is also broken down by card issuer id. This helps identify whether showing the card metadata has potential impact on latency for selecting a particular card.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCard.SelectionLatencySinceShown.{CardMetadataVisible}
histogram.summary: The latency between Autofill credit card suggestion dropdown being shown, and when a suggestion was selected, in milliseconds. Logged immediately when a card suggestion is selected by the user. Broken down by whether any card (not necessarily the selected card) in the suggestion list has card metadata available. This helps identify whether showing the card metadata has potential impact on assisting card selection in general.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCard.SyncDisabledReason
histogram.summary: When a credit card form is submitted and Chrome extracted a card from the form, Chrome runs a sequence of checks to see if it should offer upload of the card to Google Payments. The result of these checks are logged in the "Autofill.CardUploadEnabled2" histogram. If it results in the "SyncServiceMissingAutofillWalletDataActiveType" bucket, denoting that Chrome Sync was missing an active kPayments sync type, this metric additionally records the reason the sync type was deemed inactive. Logged at the time these checks happen.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCard.{CardIssuer}.SelectedWithIssuerMetadataPresentOnce
histogram.summary: Emits true if a {CardIssuer} was selected in the suggestions. Emits false if a {CardIssuer} with metadata existed in the suggestions list but was not selected from the suggestions. Logged at the time a card selection was made. Logged only once per page load.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCard.{CardIssuer}.{FormEventWithMetadata}
histogram.summary:
Emits true if a {CardIssuer}:
1. shown in Autofill suggestions had metadata
2. selected from Autofill suggestions had metadata
Emits false if:
1. every {CardIssuer} shown in Autofill suggestions did not have metadata
2. a {CardIssuer} selected from Autofill suggestions did not have metadata
Histograms without "Once" are logged every time Autofill suggestions that are shown or selected have an issuer id. Histograms with "Once" are logged once per page load.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCard.{CardNetwork}.SelectedWithIssuerMetadataPresentOnce
histogram.summary: Emits true if a {CardNetwork} was selected in the suggestions. Emits false if a {CardNetwork} with metadata existed in the suggestions list but was not selected from the suggestions. Logged at the time a card selection was made. Logged only once per page load.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCard.{CardNetwork}.{FormEventWithMetadata}
histogram.summary:
Emits true if a {CardNetwork}:
1. shown in Autofill suggestions had metadata
2. selected from Autofill suggestions had metadata
Histograms without `Once` are logged every time Autofill suggestions that are shown or selected have an issuer id. Histograms with `Once` are logged once per page load.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardInfoBar{AutofillCreditCardInfoBarSaveType}{SaveType}
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which users accept, deny, or ignore the Autofill credit card info bar prompt. {AutofillCreditCardInfoBarSaveType}, {SaveType}.

variant.name: .Local
variant.summary: Local credit card save

variant.name: .Server
variant.summary: Server/upload credit card save

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardSaveFlowResult.{SaveDestination}{SaveType}
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which users accept, deny, or ignore the Autofill credit card prompt when card is saved to for a {SaveDestination} save, {SaveType}. Note that this metric concerns the result of final save, rather than the CTR of the prompt, and this metric should record when a decision of whether card will be saved or not is made.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardsDeletedForDisuse
histogram.summary: The number of local credit cards deleted during a major version upgrade because they have not been used recently enough and are expired.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardsSuppressedForDisuse
histogram.summary: The number of credit card suggestions not shown in the Autofill popup because they have not been used recently enough and are expired. Note that suppression only applies when the user has not typed any text into the field. If any text is in the field, all matching cards are displayed, regardless of how recently they have been used and their expiration status.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardUpload.ConfirmationResult.{IsCardUploaded}
histogram.summary: Records the reason for closing the save card confirmation bubble which is shown after the credit card upload is completed. IsCardUploaded ({IsCardUploaded}) indicates whether the bubble shown was for a successful credit card upload or not. Recorded when the confirmation bubble is closed.

variant.name: CardNotUploaded
variant.summary: Credit card failed to be uploaded to the server.

variant.name: CardUploaded
variant.summary: Credit card was successfully uploaded to the server.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardUpload.ConfirmationShown.{IsCardUploaded}
histogram.summary: Records if the save card confirmation bubble is shown after credit card upload is completed. IsCardUploaded ({IsCardUploaded}) indicates whether the confirmation bubble is for a successfull credit card upload or not. Recorded after the confirmation bubble is shown or after the decision to not show the confirmation bubble.

variant.name: CardNotUploaded
variant.summary: Credit card failed to be uploaded to the server.

variant.name: CardUploaded
variant.summary: Credit card was successfully uploaded to the server.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardUpload.LoadingResult
histogram.summary: Records the reason for closing the save card loading bubble which is shown during the credit card upload. Recorded when the loading bubble is closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardUpload.LoadingShown
histogram.summary: Records if the save card loading bubble is shown during credit card upload. Recorded after the loading bubble is shown or after the decision to not show the loading bubble.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardUpload.RanLocalSaveFallback
histogram.summary: Records if a new card is locally added during a local card save fallback on credit card upload failures. This is true when the card being saved is a new addition to the local cards and false when the card is identified as an existing local card and so isn't added to the local cards. The value is recorded immediately after running the local card save fallback.

histogram.name: Autofill.CvcAuth.{CardType}.Attempt
histogram.summary: Emits true when a CVC authentication starts and does not emit any value otherwise. Broken down into sub-histograms based on the type of the card, for example virtual card or server card.

histogram.name: Autofill.CvcAuth.{CardType}.Result
histogram.summary: Logs the result of the OTP authentication, broken down into sub-histograms by card type. The different possible results can be found in the AutofillCvcAuthEvent enum, with the exception of any retriable failure, which is logged in a separate histogram. This histogram is 1:1 with Autofill.CvcAuth.{CardType}.Attempt

histogram.name: Autofill.CvcAuth.{CardType}.RetryableError
histogram.summary: Logs any retryable failure that occurs during the CVC authentication flow.

histogram.name: Autofill.CvcInfoBar.{AutofillSaveCreditCardPromptDestination}
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which users accept, deny, or ignore the Autofill info bar prompt for saving card CVC {AutofillSaveCreditCardPromptDestination}.

histogram.name: Autofill.CvcStorage.CvcFilling.{CardType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the authentication method used to fill a card that has a saved CVC. Logged when CVC was filled in the form.

histogram.name: Autofill.DataList.Events
histogram.summary: Records different events about datalist suggestions and the parsing of data list options. It is emitted at different times, including during parsing (for the respective event), suggestion generation and popup being displayed

histogram.name: Autofill.DataUtilization.ByPossibleType
histogram.summary: Records, for fields that were submitted with values that were found in the user's stored address profiles / credit cards, whether the field value was autofilled or manually entered by the user. Note that fields that were autofilled and then edited by the user or JavaScript count as "manually entered". Note that fields that were submitted with a prefilled value don't get recorded. Emitted on form submission. Broken down by the field's possible types. Possible types are the field types that correspond to stored values which matched the field value on form submission. A field can have multiple possible types. This metric is recorded for every possible type.

histogram.name: Autofill.DataUtilization.{FieldState}.ByPossibleType
histogram.summary: Split between fields that had predictions and fields that did not, records whether they were submitted with values that were found in the user's stored address profiles / credit cards, whether the field value was autofilled or manually entered by the user. Note that fields that were autofilled and then edited by the user or JavaScript count as "manually entered". Note that fields that were submitted with a prefilled value don't get recorded. Emitted on form submission. Broken down by the field's possible types. Possible types are the field types that correspond to stored values which matched the field value on form submission. A field can have multiple possible types. This metric is recorded for every possible type.

variant.name: AutocompleteOffHadPrediction
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded if AutofillField::Type() returns a known type and the autocomplete value is off.

variant.name: AutocompleteOffNoPrediction
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded if AutofillField::Type() returns an unknown type and the autocomplete value is off.

variant.name: GarbageHadPrediction
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded if AutofillField::Type() returns a known type and the autocomplete value is unrecognized.

variant.name: GarbageNoPrediction
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded if AutofillField::Type() returns an unknown type and the autocomplete value is unrecognized.

variant.name: HadPrediction
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded if AutofillField::Type() returns a known type.

variant.name: NoPrediction
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded if AutofillField::Type() returns an unknown type.

histogram.name: Autofill.DataUtilization.{FieldTypesSelection}.{FieldState}
histogram.summary: Records, for fields that were submitted with values that were found in the user's stored address profiles / credit cards, whether the field value was autofilled or manually entered by the user. Note that fields that were autofilled and then edited by the user or JavaScript count as "manually entered". Note that fields that were submitted with a prefilled value don't get recorded. Emitted on form submission.

variant.name: AllFieldTypes
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded for all field types.

variant.name: SelectedFieldTypes
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded for field types whose associated values typically are not small numbers, i.e. less than 100.

variant.name: Aggregate
variant.summary: Aggregated data of all fields (within in the selection of field types).

variant.name: Garbage
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded if the autocomplete attribute is unrecognized.

variant.name: GarbageHadPrediction
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded if the autocomplete attribute is unrecognized and if AutofillField::Type() returns a known type.

variant.name: HadPrediction
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded if AutofillField::Type() returns a known type.

variant.name: NoPrediction
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded if AutofillField::Type() returns an unknown type.

histogram.name: Autofill.DaysSinceLastUse.CreditCard
histogram.summary: Logs the number of days that have passed since the credit card was last used.

histogram.name: Autofill.DaysSinceLastUse.Profile
histogram.summary: Logged at the time of autofill address use, this histogram captures the number of days that have passed since the address was last used. I.e., the distribution of time between uses of an "active" autofill address.

histogram.name: Autofill.DaysSinceLastUse.StoredCreditCard{AutofillCreditCardType}
Autofill.DaysSinceLastUse.StoredIban.{IbanRecordType}
histogram.summary: Logs the number of days that have passed since each IBAN belonging to a given Chrome Profile was last used. This is logged for each Autofill IBAN once per Chrome User Profile load.

histogram.name: Autofill.DaysSinceLastUse.StoredProfile.{Category}
histogram.summary: This histogram captures the number of days that have passed since each stored address profile belonging to a given Chrome Profile was last used. This is logged for each Autofill address profile of the given category once per Chrome User Profile load.

histogram.name: Autofill.DaysUntilFirstUsage.Profile
histogram.summary: Records the number of days from saving an Autofill profile until using it for the first time before it got purged. Emitted on the first usage of the profile for filling a form.

histogram.name: Autofill.DOMContentLoadedInOutermostMainFrame
histogram.summary: Records whether the AutofillAgent receives a DOMContentLoaded event in an outermost main frame. This is useful as a denominator for timing metrics to see how much time is spent in a certain function per page load (where page includes the subframes).

histogram.name: Autofill.DriverRouter.TriggerFormExtractionExcept.Duration
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to trigger form extraction in all frames. This corresponds to the duration of FormForest::TriggerFormExtractionExcept() and is emitted per each execution. Note that histogram samples for clients without high-resolution clocks are dropped.

histogram.name: Autofill.DriverRouter.TriggerFormExtractionExcept.FrameCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of frames on which to trigger form extraction on. This corresponds to the number of frames that will be iterated when calling FormForest::TriggerFormExtractionExcept() and is emitted per each execution.

histogram.name: Autofill.EditedAutofilledFieldAtSubmission.AddressOnTyping
histogram.summary: Emitted on form submission, for each field where an autofill address suggestion on typing is accepted, logs whether the filled value was changed between acceptance and submission time.

histogram.name: Autofill.EditedAutofilledFieldAtSubmission2.Aggregate
histogram.summary: On submission time, this metric tracks for every field that was autofilled if the filling was accepted or subsequently corrected. This metric is aggregated over all field types.

histogram.name: Autofill.EditedAutofilledFieldAtSubmission2.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: On submission time, this metric tracks for every field that was autofilled if the filling was accepted or subsequently corrected. This metrics resolves the field type.

histogram.name: Autofill.EditedDistanceAutofilledFieldAtSubmission.AddressOnTyping
histogram.summary: The string distance between the filled value and the value submitted. Emitted on form submission for each field where an autofill address suggestion on typing is accepted.

histogram.name: Autofill.EditedPercentageAutofilledFieldAtSubmission.AddressOnTyping
histogram.summary: The ratio between the number of characters edited and the total length of the original string filled. This metric tries to measure the feature overall feature value. Emitted on form submission for each field where an autofill address suggestion on typing is accepted.

histogram.name: Autofill.EmailHeuristicOnlyAcceptance
histogram.summary:
This metric is intended to mimic the Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingAcceptance metric, but is recorded when the an email heuristic only form is observed. Counts for submitted forms whether users accepted the suggestion to fill values. This is counted as 'yes' if the user accepted such a suggestion at any time, regardless of whether other suggestions were ignored or whether the accepted suggestion was reverted afterwards.
This metric is experimental and may be removed in the future.

histogram.name: Autofill.EmailPredictionCorrectness.Precision
histogram.summary: Logs the precision of an EMAIL_ADDRESS field prediction. Emitted at form submission time for every field predicted as EMAIL_ADDRESS type.

histogram.name: Autofill.EmailPredictionCorrectness.Recall
histogram.summary: Logs the recall of an EMAIL_ADDRESS field prediction. Emitted at form submission time for every field for which its value matches the email format.

histogram.name: Autofill.ErrorDialogShown
histogram.summary: Log when an autofill error dialog is shown to the user along with its type. The type here denotes the flows in which the dialog is shown. Such flows include virtual card retrieval, masked server card risk based authentication and etc. See "AutofillErrorDialogType" for details.

histogram.name: Autofill.ErrorDialogShown.WithServerText
histogram.summary: Logs when an autofill error dialog is shown along with its type. The type here denotes the flows in which the dialog is shown. Such flows include virtual card retrieval, masked server card risk based authentication and etc. See "AutofillErrorDialogType" for details. This is a secondary histogram to the "Autofill.ErrorDialogShown" and it is logged when server side returns text to override the static client-side error messages to be shown in the dialog.

histogram.name: Autofill.ExpirationDateFixFlowPrompt.Events
histogram.summary: Events tracking the usage of the expiration date fix flow prompt. This prompt is triggered whenever expiration date must be explicitly requested from the user in order to upload the card to Google Payments.

histogram.name: Autofill.ExpirationDateFixFlowPromptShown
histogram.summary: The number of times the expiration date fix flow prompt is shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.ExtractForm{OwnershipType}.FieldCount2
histogram.summary: The number of FormFieldData contained in FormData::fields. Emitted whenever a FormData is extracted in the renderer.

variant.name: Owned
variant.summary: FormDatas for form controls inside HTML form tags.

variant.name: Unowned
variant.summary: FormDatas for unowned form controls.

histogram.name: Autofill.FastCheckout.CapabilitiesFetcher.CacheStateForIsTriggerFormSupported
histogram.summary: Cache state for when a given origin and form signature are checked for their Fast Checkout trigger form capability.

histogram.name: Autofill.FastCheckout.CapabilitiesFetcher.HttpResponseAndNetErrorCode
histogram.summary: The http response code or net error code returned on a query.

histogram.name: Autofill.FastCheckout.CapabilitiesFetcher.ParsingResult
histogram.summary: Parsing result of the response body of a Fast Checkout capabilities fetch.

histogram.name: Autofill.FastCheckout.CapabilitiesFetcher.ResponseTime
histogram.summary: Response time for fetching FastCheckout capabilities. The time is recorded for both successful and failed fetches.

histogram.name: Autofill.FastCheckout.RunOutcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of a Fast Checkout run. It is recorded when a run is completed, successfully or not, or when the run got cancelled, e.g. by the user closing the tab.

histogram.name: Autofill.FastCheckout.TriggerOutcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of an attempt to trigger a FastCheckout bottomsheet for a user that has the feature enabled and a form on a site for which FastCheckout is known to be available.

histogram.name: Autofill.FieldCount
histogram.summary: Number of fields in a form that Autofill encounters.

histogram.name: Autofill.FieldFillingStats.{FormType}
histogram.summary: Logs the status (see FieldFillingStatus) of a submitted field. Emitted once per field at submission time.

histogram.name: Autofill.FieldPrediction.PhoneNumberGrammarUsage2
histogram.summary: Logs the index of the phone number grammar that matched. Emitted when parsing forms using local heuristics.

histogram.name: Autofill.FieldPredictionOverlap.{PerAutocompleteAttribute}.{PerActiveSource}.{PerType}
histogram.summary: Which predicted types overlapped with the submitted type. Emitted on form submission. Not emitted for EMPTY_TYPE and UNKNOWN_TYPE. Not emitted when there is more than one possible type. See go/field-prediction-overlap-metric-design.

histogram.name: Autofill.FieldPredictionQuality.Aggregate.Heuristic.{LabelSource}
histogram.summary: Whether or not the heuristic type is contained in the possible types at submission time. Not emitted if the possible type is empty or unknown.

histogram.name: Autofill.FieldPredictionQuality.Aggregate{AutofillFieldPredictionSource}{AutofillFieldPredictionSubmissionEvent}
Autofill.FieldPredictionQuality.ByFieldType{AutofillFieldPredictionSource}{AutofillFieldPredictionSubmissionEvent}
Autofill.FieldPrediction{AutofillFieldPredictionSource}{AutofillFieldPredictionSubmissionEvent}
histogram.summary: Predicted and actual form field type. This is a computed sparse histogram where the value is ((predicted << 16)| actual). Predicted and actual are taken from the autofill::FieldType enumeration. {AutofillFieldPredictionSource} {AutofillFieldPredictionSubmissionEvent}

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromInteraction.WithAutofill{AutofillFormType}
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the user's first interaction with a form and the form's submission, for an autofilled form. An interaction requires changing a form control's value manually or via autofill. The interaction can happen on a different form than the one which is submitted. {AutofillFormType}

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromInteraction.WithoutAutofill{AutofillFormType}
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the user's first interaction with a form and the form's submission, for a non-autofilled form. An interaction requires changing a form control's value manually or via autofill. The interaction can happen on a different form than the one which is submitted. {AutofillFormType}

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromLoad.WithAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between form load and form submission, for an autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FillDuration.FromLoad.WithoutAutofill
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between form load and form submission, for a non-autofilled form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FilledCardInformationBubble.FieldClicked
histogram.summary: Records which field in the filled card information bubble was selected by the user and had its contents copied to the clipboard. Recorded on every click of a field in the bubble.

histogram.name: Autofill.FilledCardInformationBubble.Result.{ShowType}
histogram.summary: Records the reason for closing the filled card information bubble. Recorded when the bubble is closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.FilledCardInformationBubble.Shown
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded whenever the filled card information bubble is shown, after the user has just unmasked and autofilled a virtual card. It records whether the bubble has just appeared for the first time (false) or if it is being reshown due to user actions (true).

histogram.name: Autofill.Filling.DidAlternativeNameFieldRequireConversion
histogram.summary: Records whether the alternative name field requires transliteration from Hiragana to Katakana. It will be true if conversion is required and false otherwise. Recorded during the preview and field filling moment.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.CreditCard.Benefits
histogram.summary: Autofill form events for credit card forms that contain at least one suggestion where a card benefit is available. This includes logging for when card suggestions with benefits are shown, selected, filled, and submitted, and logs at each of those times. Log emission pertains to all credit cards with card benefits available. Each CardBenefitFormEvent metric can be recorded once per page load.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.CreditCard.Benefits.{CardBenefitSource}
histogram.summary: Autofill form events for credit card forms that contain at least one suggestion where a card benefit is available. This includes logging for when card suggestions with benefits are shown, selected, filled, and submitted, and logs at each of those times. Log emission pertains to credit cards where the benefit source is {CardBenefitSource}. Each CardBenefitFormEvent metric can be recorded once per page load.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.CreditCard.Bnpl
histogram.summary: This histogram records events related to Buy Now Pay Later (BNPL) suggestions on credit card forms of BNPL-eligible merchant sites. It tracks when the BNPL suggestion is shown, selected, filled, and submitted. Each event log is emitted when the action occurs (suggestion shown, selected, etc.). Each BnplFormEvent metric can be recorded once per page load.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.CreditCard.CardInfoRetrievalEnrolled
histogram.summary: These metrics log the autofill form events for card info retrieval enrolled card, such as when card info retrieval enrolled card suggestion(s) is/are shown, selected, or filled for a card info retrieval enrolled card, or the form is about to be submitted or submitted after a card info retrieval enrolled card is autofilled.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.CreditCard.SaveAndFill
histogram.summary: This histogram logs form events related to the Save and Fill suggestion on credit card forms. Logged once per page load when the suggestion is shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.CreditCard.WithBenefits.{CardBenefitSource}
histogram.summary: Autofill form events for credit card forms that contain at least one suggestion where a card benefit is available. This includes logging for when card suggestions with benefits are shown, selected, filled, and submitted, and logs at each of those times. Log emission pertains to credit cards where the benefit source is {CardBenefitSource}.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.{AddressFormType}
histogram.summary:
Autofill form events for {AddressFormType} forms. These are recorded when the user interacts with a form requesting an address.
Important caveat about submission metrics: - Submission using autofill data is determined by simply evaluating if there was a fill operation in this page. So, if the user filled with local data, completed erased or modified the data after and then submitted, we would only emit one "Submitted with server suggestion filled (once)"; - The submission segmentation works by checking what kind of data was last filled for this type of form in the page load. So, if a user initially filled with local data and after that filled with server, we will only emit "Submitted with server suggestion filled (once)".

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.{CreditCardFormType}{CreditCardDataAvailability}
histogram.summary:
Autofill form events for {CreditCardFormType} forms. These are recorded when the user interacts with a form requesting a credit card. {CreditCardDataAvailability}
Important caveat about submission metrics: - Submission using autofill data is determined by simply evaluating if there was a fill operation in this page. So, if the user filled with local data, then completed, erased, or modified the data after and then submitted, we would only emit one "Submitted with server suggestion filled (once)"; - The submission segmentation works by checking what kind of data was last filled for this type of form in the page load. So, if a user initially filled with local data and after that filled with server, we will only emit "Submitted with server suggestion filled (once)".

histogram.name: Autofill.FormFillingComplexScore{AutofillFormType}
histogram.summary:
For {AutofillFormType} logs a filling complex score on form submission that is calculated as following:
Score = 10 * number_of_accepted_fields + number_of_corrected_fields
The score resembles a two dimensional histogram to evaluate the number of accepted fields against the number of corrected ones. Both number of fields used in the score are limited to 9 to guaranteed that the score will be within 0 and 99 and that the significant digit corresponds to the number of accepted fields while the least significant digit corresponds to the number of corrected fields.
The score is only emitted when there is at least one correct or accepted field.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormFillingScore{AutofillFormType}
histogram.summary:
For {AutofillFormType} logs a filling score on form submission that is calculated as following:
Score = 2 * number_of_accepted_fields - 3 * number_of_corrected_fields + 100
The score is only emitted when there is at least one correct or accepted field.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormFillSuccessIOS
histogram.summary: Records whether the form was successfully filled by Autofill on iOS. Recorded after receiving the filling results from the renderer.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormForest.GetBrowserFormOfRendererForm.Duration
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to retrieve a browser form for a given renderer form. (A renderer form is a single frame's form, whereas a browser form may or may not transcend multiple frames.) This corresponds to the duration of FormForest::GetBrowserFormOfRendererForm() and is emitted per each execution. Note that histogram samples for clients without high-resolution clocks are dropped.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormForest.GetRendererFormsOfBrowserForm.Duration
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to retrieve the renderer forms for a given browser form. (A renderer form is a single frame's form, whereas a browser form may or may not transcend multiple frames.) This corresponds to the duration of FormForest::GetRendererFormsOfBrowserForm() and is emitted per each execution. Note that histogram samples for clients without high-resolution clocks are dropped.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormForest.UpdateTreeOfRendererForm.Duration
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to update Autofill's form/frame tree. This corresponds to the duration of FormForest::UpdateTreeOfRendererForm() and is emitted per each execution. Note that histogram samples for clients without high-resolution clocks are dropped.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormForest.UpdateTreeOfRendererForm.Visits
histogram.summary: Records nodes visited on a form/frame tree. This is emitted per each call of FormForest::UpdateTreeOfRendererForm() that actually does an entire tree traversal.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormsAiSettingsPage.VisitReferrer
histogram.summary: Records the entry point (referrer) every time the user visits the 'Forms AI' settings page from a tracked entry point. This metric is emitted on navigation to the page, with the enum values distinguishing the entry points (different ways of reaching the page).

histogram.name: Autofill.FormSubmission.PerProfileType
histogram.summary: This histogram records the browser profile type when an autofill form is submitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.Funnel.ClassifiedAsTargetFilling.FillAfterSuggestion.Password
histogram.summary:
Counts whether users accepted any password suggestion that was shown to them for a given form. This metric is conditioned to those suggestions that were triggered via the context menu on a field that matches the target filling product password.
This metric is only recorded if a suggestion for the password form was shown, accepted, and the suggestion was filled successfully. This is recorded once per navigation. It is reported as "User chose to fill" once. It does not matter if the user clears the filled values nor if the user accepts a different suggestion later.
If the accepted suggestion is not filled (e.g., if it required authentication and the user cancelled or failed that step), then this metric is not recorded.

histogram.name: Autofill.Funnel.FillAfterSuggestion.{FormType}
histogram.summary:
Counts whether users accepted any autofill suggestion that was shown to them for a given form.
This metric is only recorded if a suggestion for the {FormType} was shown, accepted, and the suggestion was filled successfully. This is recorded once per navigation. It is reported as "User chose to fill" once. It does not matter if the user clears the filled values nor if the user accepts a different suggestion later.
If the accepted suggestion is not filled (e.g., if it required authentication and the user cancelled or failed that step), then this metric is not recorded.

histogram.name: Autofill.Funnel.InteractionAfterParsedAsType.{FormType}
Autofill.Funnel.NotClassifiedAsTargetFilling.FillAfterSuggestion.Password
histogram.summary:
Counts whether users accepted any password suggestion that was shown to them for a given form. This metric is conditioned to those suggestions that were triggered via the context menu on a field that does not match the target filling product.
This metric is only recorded if a password suggestion was shown, accepted, and the suggestion was filled successfully. This is recorded once per navigation. It is reported as "User chose to fill" once. It does not matter if the user clears the filled values nor if the user accepts a different suggestion later.
If the accepted suggestion is not filled (e.g., if it required authentication and the user cancelled or failed that step), then this metric is not recorded.

histogram.name: Autofill.Funnel.ParsedAsType.{FormType}
histogram.summary:
Counts whether a form was parsed/interpreted to be of the type indicated in the histogram name.
This metric is recorded once for each form observed by Autofill. If a form changes dynamically, then Autofill treats the different versions of the form as different forms. {FormType}

histogram.name: Autofill.Funnel.SubmissionAfterFill.{FormType}
Autofill.Funnel.SuggestionAfterInteraction.{FormType}
histogram.summary:
Counts whether users were shown suggestions to fill the form, given that they have already interacted with the form.
This metric is recorded only for forms that users interacted with. It is recorded only once per form, meaning that it does not matter how often the user sees suggestions. If a form changes dynamically, then Autofill treats the different versions of the form as different forms. {FormType}

histogram.name: Autofill.HomeAndWork.ProfileFiltered
histogram.summary:
Tracks whether a Home/Work profile was filtered out due to incompleteness. Emitted the moment Home/Work profiles are received or updated via sync.
Since the server already checks completeness on a best-effort basis, this metric is not representative of the total fraction of incomplete Home/Work addresses.

histogram.name: Autofill.HomeAndWork.RemovedFromChrome.{Type}
