histogram.summary: On browser startup, emits whether the user has chosen to remove their {Type} address from Chrome. Only emitted for users with a {Type} address.

histogram.name: Autofill.HomeAndWork.SilentUpdates.Lost
histogram.summary: On sign-out, emits the total number of silent updates to Home and Work addresses since the previous sign-out. Since these silent updates are not synced, this corresponds to the total number of silent updates lost.

histogram.name: Autofill.HomeAndWork.SilentUpdates.Performed
histogram.summary: Whenever a Home and Work address is updated, emits the total number of silent updates that this address has received since the last sign-out. The total count of this metrics puts the number of Autofill.HomeAndWork.SilentUpdates.Lost into perspective.

histogram.name: Autofill.HomeAndWork.SilentUpdates.Usage
histogram.summary: Whenever a Home and Work address is filled, logs whether this address has received any silent updates since the last sign-out.

histogram.name: Autofill.HomeAndWork.SuggestionPresent.{SuggestionType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the presence of a home/work profile in address suggestions at least once during the form interaction. Metric emitted at form submission time, only when a user has a home/work profile set and if at least one suggestion was shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.Iban.CountryOfSaveAcceptedIban
histogram.summary: The country code of an IBAN that was accepted to be saved. Recorded upon the user deciding to accept the offer to save the IBAN. This metric includes both local and server IBANs.

histogram.name: Autofill.Iban.CountryOfSaveOfferedIban
histogram.summary: The country code of an IBAN that was offered to be saved. Recorded upon deciding whether to offer save.

histogram.name: Autofill.Iban.CountryOfSelectedIban
histogram.summary: The country code of an IBAN suggestion that was selected. Recorded when the user clicks on the IBAN suggestion. This metric includes both local and server IBANs.

histogram.name: Autofill.Iban.ShowSuggestionsBlocklistDecision
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user has IBANs and clicks on an IBAN form field. Logs whether IBAN suggestions were allowed to be shown, blocked from being shown, or if the blocklist was not accessible at all.

histogram.name: Autofill.Iban.Suggestions
histogram.summary: These metrics are relevant to the IBAN suggestions popup, such as when it is shown or when a suggestion is selected. The IBAN-based suggestions popup gets displayed when a form's field that can be autofilled with an IBAN is selected, and the user has at least one IBAN saved. The metric is recorded upon each action, such as IBAN suggestions being shown or selected.

histogram.name: Autofill.Iban.UnmaskIbanDuration{UnmaskIbanResult}
histogram.summary: Recorded at a successful return of an unmask server IBAN call. This metric tracks the duration from the user's click on a server IBAN suggestion to the successful reception of a response of unmasking a server IBAN.

variant.summary: UnmaskIban request overall

variant.name: .Failure
variant.summary: UnmaskIban request failed

variant.name: .Success
variant.summary: UnmaskIban request succeeded

histogram.name: Autofill.Iban.UnmaskIbanResult
histogram.summary: Recorded upon receiving the response for an unmask server IBAN call. This metric tracks whether the unmask call succeeded or failed.

histogram.name: Autofill.IbanUpload.SaveFailed
histogram.summary: Indicates that an IBAN upload save failed, logged at the time of failure. Records true if the IBAN was able to be saved locally as a fallback, or false if it was not (such as in the case of an existing local IBAN).

histogram.name: Autofill.IbanUploadEnabled
histogram.summary: Logs the reason why (or why not) IBAN upload was enabled. Logged when a user submits a form, which triggers the check to decide whether to ask the users if they want to upload the IBAN.

histogram.name: Autofill.IbanUploadEnabled.{AutofillPaymentsSigninState}
histogram.summary: Logs the reason why (or why not) IBAN upload was enabled. Logged when a user submits a form, which triggers the check to decide whether to ask the users if they want to upload the IBAN.

histogram.name: Autofill.ImageFetcher.{AutofillImage}.OverallResultOnBrowserStart
histogram.summary: Records the image fetching overall result for a {AutofillImage} on browser startup. Logged once for each {AutofillImage} either when the fetching was successful or when a preset maximum number of fetching attempts were made. Logs true if the image was fetched successfully, and false if the image fetching was unsuccessful after a preset maximum number of attempts.

histogram.name: Autofill.ImageFetcher.{AutofillImage}.Result
histogram.summary: Records the image fetch result of a {AutofillImage} image. Logged every time an attempt is made to fetch the {AutofillImage}, including retries. All attempts are made during browser startup. If the image was fetched successfully, logs true, false otherwise.

histogram.name: Autofill.iOS.FormActivity.SendRatio
histogram.summary: Records the percentage of form activities that were really sent to the browser from the renderer. Recorded when the browser receives the last message of a batch of form activity messages. Only recorded on iOS.

histogram.name: Autofill.iOS.FormActivity.SubmissionDetectedBeforeProcessing.BatchSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the batch of form submission reports. Recorded when when the browser receives a batch of reports. Only recorded on iOS.

histogram.name: Autofill.iOS.FormActivity.SubmissionDetectedBeforeProcessing.PerType.{Source}
histogram.summary: Records the type of form submission detected in the renderer before processing the submission (including throttling), split by {Source} of reporting. Recorded when the browser receives the form submission count report. Only recorded on iOS.

variant.name: FromInstant
variant.summary: instant reporting, no throttling

variant.name: FromScheduledTask
variant.summary: reporting done via a scheduled task

variant.name: FromUnloadPage
variant.summary: reporting done on page unload

histogram.name: Autofill.iOS.FormActivity.{Outcome}Count
histogram.summary: Records the number of form activies observed in the renderer where {Outcome}. Recorded when the browser receives the last message of a batch of form activity messages. Only recorded on iOS.

variant.name: Drop
variant.summary: form activity was dropped

variant.name: Send
variant.summary: form activity sent to the browser

histogram.name: Autofill.iOS.FormExtraction.ForScan.BatchSize
histogram.summary: Records the number of form extraction requests in a form extraction batch done for scanning a document, when batching is enabled. Recorded when the batch delayed task is run regardless of the outcome of the task (e.g. the task failed because the frame disappeared somewhere between scheduling and running).

histogram.name: Autofill.iOS.FormRemoval.RemovedUnownedFields
histogram.summary: Records then number of removed formless fields in a form removal event. Recorded when a set of html forms or formless fields are removed from the page. Maximum number of fields recorded is 100. iOS only.

histogram.name: Autofill.iOS.FormRemoval.SubmissionDetected
histogram.summary: Records whether a form submission was inferred after html forms or formless fields were removed from the page. Recorded when a set of html forms or formless fields are removed from the page. iOS only.

histogram.name: Autofill.iOS.FormSubmission.IsProgrammatic
histogram.summary: Records whether an http form submission was triggered by a script (i.e. form.submit()). On iOS, we have to modify the prototype of HtmlFormElement to detect programmatic form submissions. This histogram is for tracking which submissions are detected through the modified prototype. Recorded when the browser process receives a form submission message from the renderer. iOS only.

histogram.name: Autofill.iOS.FormSubmission.Outcome.InvalidFormReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason why a submitted form data was found invalid by the browser process. Recorded when the browser process receives a form submission message from the renderer. iOS only.

histogram.name: Autofill.iOS.FormSubmission.OutcomeV2
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of a form submission on iOS. This histogram tracks the various reasons why a form submission message received by the browser process from the renderer may be invalid or successfully handled. Recorded when the browser process receives a form submission message from the renderer. iOS only.

histogram.name: Autofill.iOS.TriggeredFormExtractionFromDriver.{Range}
histogram.summary: Records the number of form extractions that were triggered on a frame during its driver lifetime. Covers a {Range} of possible counts to balance between coverage and precision by offering different levels of granularity. Each driver (aka each frame), records their count. Recorded when the driver is deleted and if there was at least one extraction done.

variant.name: LargeRange
variant.summary: large range of possible counts

variant.name: MediumRange
variant.summary: medium range of possible counts

variant.name: SmallRange
variant.summary: small range of possible counts

histogram.name: Autofill.IsEnabled.PageLoad
histogram.summary: This includes Autofill.Address.IsEnabled.PageLoad and Autofill.CreditCard.IsEnabled.PageLoad, and tracks whether either profile Autofill or payment Autofill is enabled on page load for a page containing forms. It helps deduce the overlap by showing what percentage of users have one type of Autofill enabled but not the other.

histogram.name: Autofill.IsEnabled.Startup
histogram.summary: This includes Autofill.Address.IsEnabled.Startup and Autofill.CreditCard.IsEnabled.Startup, and tracks whether either profile Autofill or payment Autofill is enabled when Chrome launches. It helps deduce the overlap by showing what percentage of users have one type of Autofill enabled but not the other.

histogram.name: Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingAcceptance.GroupedByFocusedFieldType
histogram.summary:
Emitted for submitted forms. For each field type, records whether the user accepted a suggestion or not from a field with that type, provided that a suggestion was shown for such a field.
"Foo: Accepted" means that regardless how many times the user ignored suggestions of fields with type "Foo", they accepted a suggestion on such a field at least once before submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingAcceptance.{FormType}
histogram.summary: Counts for submitted forms whether users accepted the suggestion to fill values. This is counted as 'yes' if the user accepted such a suggestion at any time, regardless whether other suggestions were ignored or whether the accepted suggestion was reverted afterwards. {FormType}

histogram.name: Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingAssistance.{FormType}
Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingCorrectness.{FormType}
histogram.summary: Counts for submitted and autofilled forms whether users edited at least one filled value before submitting the form. {FormType}

histogram.name: Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingReadiness.{FormType}
histogram.summary:
Counts for submitted forms whether Chromium had any address or payments data to fill.
It does not matter whether the user actually requested to fill the data. It does not matter either whether the data available for filling corresponded to the submitted data. {FormType}

histogram.name: Autofill.KeyMetrics.FormSubmission.Autofilled.{FormType}
Autofill.KeyMetrics.FormSubmission.NotAutofilled.{FormType}
Autofill.LabelInference.InferredLabelSource.AtSubmission2
histogram.summary: Logs how/if the label of an input was derived. Emitted at form submission for every field where the data the user entered matches some stored Autofill data.

histogram.name: Autofill.Leipzig.Duplication.NumberOfLocalSupersetProfilesOnStartup
histogram.summary: Logs the number of kLocalOrSynable profiles that are a strict superset of some kAccount profile. This corresponds to the number of profiles that cannot be automatically deduplicated, since no profiles should be silently deleted from the account storage. Emitted when the Chrome user profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Autofill.Leipzig.FillingAssistanceCategory
histogram.summary: Like Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingAssistance.Address, but split by profile category.

histogram.name: Autofill.Leipzig.FillingCorrectness.{Category}
histogram.summary: Like Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingCorrectness.Address, but split by profile category.

variant.name: AccountChrome
variant.summary: Only kAccount profiles originating from Chrome were used

variant.name: AccountHome
variant.summary: Only a kAccountHome profile was used

variant.name: AccountNameEmail
variant.summary: Only a kAccountNameEmail profile was used

variant.name: AccountNonChrome
variant.summary: Only kAccount profiles originating from outside Chrome were used

variant.name: AccountWork
variant.summary: Only a kAccountWork profile was used

variant.name: Legacy
variant.summary: Only kLegacyOrSyncable profiles were used

variant.name: Mixed
variant.summary: Multiple profiles of mixed categories were used

histogram.name: Autofill.Leipzig.FillingReadinessCategory
histogram.summary: Like Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingReadiness.Address, but split by profile category.

histogram.name: Autofill.LocalHeuristics.MatchedAttribute
histogram.summary: Whenever local heuristics are computed, logs the MatchAttribute that was used to determine the heuristic type for each field. "None" means that no parser found a classification for the field, resulting in an UNKNOWN_TYPE. "Ambiguous" means that multiple MatchAttributes matched for different regexes. Since local heuristics attempt to match regexes against the label first, this metric is skewed towards label matches. A match in the label doesn't imply that the name wouldn't have matched, but a match in name means that the label did't match.

histogram.name: Autofill.LogEvent.{LogEventTypes}
histogram.summary: The number of log events of type {LogEventTypes} which have been recorded until the FieldInfo metric is recorded into UKM at form submission or form destruction time (whatever comes first).

variant.name: AblationEvent
variant.summary: total number of AblationEvent events recorded

variant.name: All
variant.summary: total number of all the log events recorded

variant.name: AskForValuesToFillEvent
variant.summary: total number of AskForValuesToFillFieldLogEvent events recorded

variant.name: AutocompleteAttributeEvent
variant.summary: total number of AutocompleteAttributeFieldLogEvent events recorded

variant.name: FillEvent
variant.summary: total number of FillFieldLogEvent events recorded

variant.name: HeuristicPredictionEvent
variant.summary: total number of HeuristicPredictionFieldLogEvent events recorded

variant.name: RationalizationEvent
variant.summary: total number of RationalizationFieldLogEvent events recorded

variant.name: ServerPredictionEvent
variant.summary: total number of ServerPredictionFieldLogEvent events recorded

variant.name: TriggerFillEvent
variant.summary: total number of TriggerFillFieldLogEvent events recorded

variant.name: TypingEvent
variant.summary: total number of TypingFieldLogEvent events recorded

histogram.name: Autofill.LoyaltyCard.EmailOrLoyaltyCardAcceptance
histogram.summary: Metric to measure acceptance on `EMAIL_OR_LOYALTY_MEMBERSHIP_ID` fields. This metric is emitted every time user selects email or loyalty card suggestion presented for `EMAIL_OR_LOYALTY_MEMBERSHIP_ID` fields as long as the user has any loyalty cards available.

histogram.name: Autofill.LoyaltyCard.FillingAcceptance.Affiliated
histogram.summary:
Like Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingAcceptance.Address, but for affiliated loyalty cards.
Counts for submitted forms whether users accepted the suggestion to fill values. This is counted as 'yes' if the user accepted such a suggestion at any time, regardless whether other suggestions were ignored or whether the accepted suggestion was reverted afterwards.

histogram.name: Autofill.LoyaltyCard.FillingAssistance.Affiliated
histogram.summary:
Like Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingAssistance.Address, but for affiliated loyalty cards.
Counts for submitted forms whether the user filled any fields via Autofill. If the user reverts the filling, the form is still counted as filled. This metric is different from Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingAcceptance in the sense that the latter is only recorded if the user has actually seen a prompt to fill data.

histogram.name: Autofill.LoyaltyCard.FillingCorrectness.{Category}
histogram.summary:
Like Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingCorrectness.Address, but split by affiliation category.
Counts for submitted and autofilled forms whether users edited at least one filled value before submitting the form.

variant.name: Affiliated
variant.summary: Only affiliated loyalty cards were used

variant.name: Mixed
variant.summary: Multiple profiles of mixed categories were used

variant.name: NonAffiliated
variant.summary: Only non-affiliated loyalty cards were used

histogram.name: Autofill.LoyaltyCard.FillingReadinessAffiliationCategory
histogram.summary:
Like Autofill.KeyMetrics.FillingReadiness.Address, but split by affiliation category.
Counts for submitted forms whether Chromium had any loyalty card data to fill. It does not matter whether the user actually requested to fill the data. It does not matter either whether the data available for filling corresponded to the submitted data.

histogram.name: Autofill.LoyaltyCard.StoredCardsCount
histogram.summary: The number of loyalty cards stored in Chrome, measured at Chrome profile launch.

histogram.name: Autofill.ManageCardsPrompt
histogram.summary: The frequency of user interactions with the Manage Cards prompt, which is shown after a successful local card save.

histogram.name: Autofill.ManualFallback.ExplicitlyTriggered.ClassifiedAsTargetFilling.Password
histogram.summary: Records per form type the acceptance of manual fallback suggestions on fields that are classified as the target filling product password. This tracks the number of times a user accepted/didn't accept the manual fallback option in the context menu. Emitted on navigation (when the PasswordAutofillManager is destroyed/reset), at most once per page.

histogram.name: Autofill.ManualFallback.ExplicitlyTriggered.NotClassifiedAsTargetFilling.Password
histogram.summary: Records per form type the acceptance of manual fallback suggestions on fields that are either unclassified or classified differently than the filling product password. This tracks the number of times a user accepted/didn't accept the manual fallback option in the context menu. Emitted on navigation (when the PasswordAutofillManager is destroyed/reset), at most once per page.

histogram.name: Autofill.Message.{MessageType}.{Event}
histogram.summary: Emits true when an autofill Android Message event occurs (shown, dismissed, etc.) and does not emit any value otherwise. See event variants for additional details on when each individual logging event happens.

variant.name: SaveCardFailure
variant.summary: Autofill Android Message shown after a credit card has failed to have been saved to the server.

variant.name: VirtualCardEnrollFailure
variant.summary: Autofill Android Message shown after a virtual card has failed to have been enrolled.

variant.name: ActionClicked
variant.summary: Event for when the action button on the message is clicked by the user.

variant.name: Dismissed
variant.summary: Event for when the message is dismissed.

variant.name: Shown
variant.summary: Event for when the message is initially shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.NameTokenVerificationStatusAtProfileUsage.{NameType}
histogram.summary: For each {NameType} in a given AutofillProfile, the verification status of the corresponding non-empty type is recorded when a profile is used to fill a form.

variant.name: Any
variant.summary: any of the following

variant.name: FirstLast
variant.summary: the first last name of the profile

variant.name: Full
variant.summary: the full name of the profile

variant.name: Last
variant.summary: the last name of the profile

variant.name: Middle
variant.summary: the middle name of the profile

variant.name: SecondLast
variant.summary: the second last name of the profile

histogram.name: Autofill.NumberOfDriversPerFactory
histogram.summary: Records the maximum number of simultaneously existing drivers that a factory saw over its lifetime. Recorded on all platforms. Recorded on destruction of the factory, which happens on destruction of the WebContents / WebState.

histogram.name: Autofill.NumberOfFieldsPerAutofill
histogram.summary: Records the number of autofilled fields per autofill operation. Only filling operations that may affect multiple fields are logged (that is, no preview, no undo, no autocomplete, no IBANs, for example, but email-only forms because they are treated as address forms even if they contain a single field). Recorded in Chrome on all platforms.

histogram.name: Autofill.NumberOfFieldsPerAutofill.{FillTypeData}
histogram.summary: Records the number of autofilled fields per {FillTypeData} autofill operation. Only filling operations are logged (that is, no preview, no undo). Recorded in Chrome on all platforms.

variant.name: AutofillProfile
variant.summary: AutofillProfile (address)

variant.name: EntityInstance
variant.summary: EntityInstance (Autofill AI)

histogram.name: Autofill.NumberOfFramesPerFormForest
histogram.summary: Records the maximum number of simultaneously existing `FormForest::FrameData` objects that a `AutofillDriverRouter` saw over its lifetime. Recorded on all platforms. Recorded on destruction of the router, which happens on destruction of the WebContents.

histogram.name: Autofill.NumberOfNamesMigratedToAlternativeNamesDuringCleanUp
histogram.summary: The number of phonetic names that have been migrated from regular name fields to alternative name fields during cleanup. Emitted on every startup.

histogram.name: Autofill.NumberOfProfilesConsideredForDedupe
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill profiles that have been considered for deduplication. Emitted once per major version, if the user has at least two profiles.

histogram.name: Autofill.NumberOfProfilesRemovedDuringDedupe
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill profiles that have been removed during deduplication. Emitted once per major version, if the user has at least two profiles.

histogram.name: Autofill.OneTimeTokens.Backend.Sms.APIError
histogram.summary: Records the error encountered while attempting to retrieve sms one time token from the GMSCore backend. This is recorded after the asynchronous call comes back with an error. This is currently only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: Autofill.OneTimeTokens.Backend.Sms.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: Records the error encountered while attempting to retrieve sms one time token from the GMSCore backend. This is recorded after the asynchronous call comes back with an error. This is currently only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: Autofill.OneTimeTokens.Backend.Sms.ErrorLatency
histogram.summary: Real-time duration of the asynchronous attempt to retrieve sms one time token from the GMSCore backend. Recorded when the asynchronous job failed. This is currently only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: Autofill.OneTimeTokens.Backend.Sms.Success
histogram.summary: Records whether the attempt to retrieve sms one time token from the GMSCore backend succeeds. Recorded when the asynchronous job has returned. This is currently only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: Autofill.OneTimeTokens.Backend.Sms.SuccessLatency
histogram.summary: Real-time duration of the asynchronous attempt to retrieve sms one time token from the GMSCore backend. Only recorded when the asynchronous job has returned successfully. This is currently only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: Autofill.OneTimeTokens.PhishGuard.CheckPerformed
histogram.summary: Whether a PhishGuard check was performed before offering to autofill one-time tokens. Recorded every time a one-time token field is detected.

histogram.name: Autofill.OneTimeTokens.PhishGuard.Latency
histogram.summary: The latency of a PhishGuard check before offering to autofill one-time tokens. Recorded every time a PhishGuard check is completed.

histogram.name: Autofill.OneTimeTokens.PhishGuard.Verdict
histogram.summary: The verdict of a PhishGuard check before offering to autofill one-time tokens. Recorded every time a PhishGuard check is completed.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpAuth.{CardType}.{OtpAuthType}.Attempt
histogram.summary: Emits true when an OTP authentication starts and does not emit any value otherwise.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpAuth.{CardType}.{OtpAuthType}.RequestLatency.SelectChallengeOptionRequest
histogram.summary: Logs the roundtrip latency of the SelectChallengeOptionRequest in the OTP authentication.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpAuth.{CardType}.{OtpAuthType}.RequestLatency.UnmaskCardRequest
histogram.summary: Logs the roundtrip latency of the UnmaskCardRequest in the OTP authentication.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpAuth.{CardType}.{OtpAuthType}.Result
histogram.summary: Logs the result of the OTP authentication.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpAuth.{CardType}.{OtpAuthType}.RetriableError
histogram.summary: Logs any retriable failure before the OTP authentication completes.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpInputDialog.{CardType}.{OtpAuthType}.ErrorMessageShown
histogram.summary: Logs the type of the error when any temporary error is shown in the card unmask OTP dialog.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpInputDialog.{CardType}.{OtpAuthType}.NewOtpRequested
histogram.summary: Emits true when the "Get New Code" button is clicked and a new OTP is requested. Doesn't emit any other value.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpInputDialog.{CardType}.{OtpAuthType}.Result
histogram.summary: Logs the reason of the closure when the card unmask OTP dialog is closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpInputDialog.{CardType}.{OtpAuthType}.Result.{WithError}
histogram.summary: Logs the reason of the closure when the card unmask OTP dialog is closed. This breaks down on whether any temporary error happened before the card unmask OTP dialog was closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpInputDialog.{CardType}.{OtpAuthType}.Shown
histogram.summary: Emits true when the card unmask OTP dialog is shown. Doesn't emit any other value.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpInputDialog.{OtpAuthType}.ErrorMessageShown
histogram.summary: Logs the type of the error when any temporary error is shown in the card unmask OTP dialog.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpInputDialog.{OtpAuthType}.NewOtpRequested
histogram.summary: Emits true when the "Get New Code" button is clicked and a new OTP is requested. Doesn't emit any other value.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpInputDialog.{OtpAuthType}.Result
histogram.summary: Logs the reason of the closure when the card unmask OTP dialog is closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpInputDialog.{OtpAuthType}.Result.{WithError}
histogram.summary: Logs the reason of the closure when the card unmask OTP dialog is closed. This breaks down on whether any temporary error happened before the card unmask OTP dialog was closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpInputDialog.{OtpAuthType}.Shown
histogram.summary: Emits true when the card unmask OTP dialog is shown. Doesn't emit any other value.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.CardBenefitsIsEnabled.Startup
histogram.summary: Tracks enablement of the credit card benefits toggle on the payment methods settings page. This histogram will be populated during profile loadup for users who have enabled autofill for payment methods. A value of true denotes that credit card benefits are enabled for the user, while false denotes that they are not.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.CheckoutFlow.ReauthUsage.{PaymentMethodType}.{AuthenticationMethod}
histogram.summary: Tracks the users mandatory reauth result during the checkout flow for opted-in users breakdown by each card type and each authentication method. Whenever a reauth opted-in user starts, succeeds or fails the mandatory reauth flow during a payments autofill form fill, we will log the MandatoryReauthAuthEvent to this histogram. This is logged in order to get the reauth usages and corresponding success rate for each breakdown. This subhistogram pertains to {PaymentMethodType}s that used {AuthenticationMethod} during the checkout flow.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.CvcStorageIsEnabled.Startup
histogram.summary: Tracks the user opt-in rate for CVC storage. This histogram will be populated during profile loadup for users who have enabled autofill for payments. It is not reported for incognito profiles. A value of true denotes that the CVC feature is enabled, while false denotes the feature is disabled.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.MandatoryReauth.AuthEvent.SettingsPage.{ActionType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the auth result when the user tries to {ActionType} and mandatory reauth feature is enabled. Whenever a user tries to {ActionType}, we will log into the `flow started` bucket. The user would then be challenged with an auth, where if the auth was successful, we will log in the `flow succeded` bucket, else we will log in the `flow failed` bucket.

variant.name: DeleteCard
variant.summary: delete a card from the payment methods settings

variant.name: EditCard
variant.summary: edit a card on the payment methods settings

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.MandatoryReauth.CheckoutFlow.ReauthOfferOptInDecision2
histogram.summary: Logs the detailed reason why (or why not) mandatory reauth opt-in was offered during a credit card checkout flow. Whenever we determine whether to offer the mandatory reauth opt-in prompt, we will log the decision result to this histogram.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.MandatoryReauth.OptChangeEvent.{Source}.{ChangingStatus}
histogram.summary: Tracks the users auth result during the {ChangingStatus} flow for the mandatory reauth feature. Whenever a user triggers to change the mandatory reauth feature from the {Source}, we will log into the `flow started` bucket. The user would then be challenged with an auth, where if the auth was successful, we will log in the `flow succeded` bucket, else we will log in the `flow failed` bucket.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.MandatoryReauth.OptInBubbleOffer.{ShowType}
histogram.summary: Tracks events related to offering the mandatory reauth opt-in feature, for instance when it is shown or why it is not shown. This metric is recorded when the mandatory reauth opt-in prompt is or is not displayed. Mandatory reauth requires the user to unlock their device or pass a biometric auth when autofilling payment method information.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.MandatoryReauth.OptInBubbleResult.{ShowType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason the mandatory reauth opt-in prompt was closed. This metric is recorded when the user closes the mandatory reauth opt-in prompt. Mandatory reauth requires the user to unlock their device or pass a biometric auth when autofilling payment method information.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.MandatoryReauth.OptInConfirmationBubble
histogram.summary: Tracks various events related to the mandatory reauth opt-in confirmation prompt. These metrics are recorded when the prompt is displayed or the user interacts with the prompt. Mandatory reauth requires the user to unlock their device or pass a biometric auth when autofilling payment method information.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.SettingsPage.StoredCreditCardCountBeforeCardAdded
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of stored credit cards (both local and server) after a user adds a new local card through the Chrome payment methods settings page. The number of existing cards is calculated before saving the new card, but the value is recorded after saving the new card. Note that the new local card is not counted towards this number (i.e. if there aren't any existing cards when adding the new card, the "cards" bucket labeled 0 will be incremented).

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethodsSettingsPage.AddCardClicked2
histogram.summary:
Logs when the add card flow is started. Recorded when a user starts the flow to add a new local card through the Chrome payment methods settings page.
Note that a previous version of this histogram incorrectly measured both add and edit cases, and was obsoleted in mid-June 2025.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethodsSettingsPage.AddCardClickedWithoutExistingCards2
histogram.summary:
Logs true when the add card flow is started when the user does not have any existing cards. If the user has existing cards, this metric is logged as false. Recorded when a user starts the flow to add a new card through the Chrome payment methods settings page and they do not have any existing cards.
Note that a previous version of this histogram incorrectly measured both add and edit cases, and was obsoleted in mid-June 2025.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethodsSettingsPage.CardAddedWithoutExistingCards
histogram.summary: Logs true when a card is saved when the user does not have any existing cards. If the user has existing cards, this metric is logged as false. Recorded when a user adds a new card through the Chrome payment methods settings page and they do not have any existing cards.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethodsSettingsPage.CardsViewedWithoutExistingCards
histogram.summary:
Logs true when the cards are viewed when the user does not have any existing cards. If the user has existing cards, this metric is logged as false. Recorded only if Autofill for Payment methods is enabled, when a user either enters the Payment Methods Settings Page or if that page is rebuilt while the user is on it (e.g., if a preference toggle is changed or new payment methods are synced).
Note that this metric does not care about the presence or absence of other payment methods (e.g., IBAN, pay over time, etc). It only measures whether or not there are local or server cards shown on the settings page.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethodsSettingsPage.ScanCardResult
histogram.summary: Logs how (or if) the credit card scanner is used by the user in the payment methods settings page. Recorded when a user hits the save button to save a new credit card through the Chrome payment methods settings page and there is a credit card scanner shown to the user on the payments methods settings page.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethodsSettingsPage.VisitReferrer
histogram.summary: Records the entry point (referrer) every time the user visits the 'Payment methods' settings page from a tracked entry point. This metric is emitted on navigation to the page, with the enum values distinguishing the entry points (different ways of reaching the page).

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentsDataManager.LocalCardAdded
histogram.summary: Logs when a credit card is saved locally for any reason. This includes when a server card upload fails, or when the user adds a new local card through the Chrome payment methods settings page.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentsNetworkInterface.RequestLatency.GetCardUploadDetails{Result}
histogram.summary: Logs the roundtrip latency of a GetCardUploadDetailsRequest in the PaymentsNetworkInterface. This is recorded when the response is received (right before the callback is called).

variant.summary: Includes all result types.

variant.name: .Failure
variant.summary: Failed to get the card upload details.

variant.name: .Success
variant.summary: Successfully got the card upload details.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentsNetworkInterface.{PaymentsRequestType}.ClientSideTimedOut
histogram.summary:
For an API call to Google Payments servers of type {PaymentsRequestType}, denotes whether or not that API call triggered the client-side timeout. Logged when the request either completes or times out on the client side, and only if there is a client-side timeout value specified for the given type.
The non-timeout case is logged only if the request succeeds according to the server, to try to best measure the ratio of failed calls that are due to the client-side timeout.

histogram.name: Autofill.PerfectFilling.{FormType}
histogram.summary:
For a form of type {FormType}, log at submission time if the filling experience was perfect. In a perfect filling experience, the user must have not edited any field, meaning that the filed must either be autofilled without prefix-matching and without further corrections, empty, have the same value as pageload or have its value set by JavaScript.
Note that the {FormType} is not mutually exclusive. If a single form contains both address and credit card information, the metric is recorded for each {FormType}. In such a combined form, both the address and the credit card information needs to be filled perfectly, in order to record perfect filling.

variant.name: Addresses
variant.summary: Form contains address information.

variant.name: CreditCards
variant.summary: Form contains credit card information.

histogram.name: Autofill.PopupHidingReason
histogram.summary: This tracks the reasons for which the Autofill popup disappers or cannot be displayed. Recorded everytime an Autofill popup disappears or cannot be displayed.

histogram.name: Autofill.PopupHidingReason.{FillingProduct}
histogram.summary: This tracks per filling product the reasons for which the Autofill popup disappers or cannot be displayed. Recorded everytime an Autofill popup disappears or cannot be displayed.

histogram.name: Autofill.PopupInteraction.PopupLevel.{AutofillPopupInteractionLevel}
histogram.summary: This is emitted when {AutofillPopupInteractionLevel}. Its goal is to learn about user's behaviour related to the Autofill popup therefore it is only emitted on desktop.

histogram.name: Autofill.PopupInteraction.PopupLevel.{AutofillPopupInteractionLevel}.{FillingProduct}
histogram.summary: This is emitted when {AutofillPopupInteractionLevel}. This is also specific for a {FillingProduct}. It is emitted when the popup is shown, a suggestion is selected (hover) or accepted. Its goal is to learn about user's behaviour related to the Autofill popup therefore it is only emitted on desktop.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileDeleted.ImplicitAccountNameEmail
histogram.summary: Records true when the AccountNameEmail profile gets implicitly removed, because of the not accepted suggestions strike limit hit. Records false if the suggestion contained AccountNameEmail profile, but the counter is lower than the removal threshold. Recorded after user leaves the page with form where a suggestion containing AccountNameEmail profile was shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileDeleted.{DeletionType}.{RecordType}

variant.name: Any
variant.summary: This metric records how many users tried to delete an address and whether they canceled or confirmed the deletion (regardless of how the address was deleted).

variant.name: KeyboardAccessory
variant.summary: This metric records how many users long-pressed on an address suggestion button in the keyboard accessory, and whether they canceled or confirmed the deletion.

variant.name: Popup
variant.summary: Counts how many users deleted an address using shift+delete while hovering on a first-level popup. This metric is emitted only for the "Confirmed" bucket, as the user cannot cancel this process.

variant.name: Settings
variant.summary: This metric records how many users pressed the "Delete address" button in chrome://settings, and whether they canceled or confirmed the deletion.

variant.name: Total
variant.summary: Any record type, it will contain deletions for all record types.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.HomeAndWorkSupersetAffectedType
histogram.summary: Logs that a value for a specific type was changed or added, which caused a home/work superset prompt to be shown. The metric is independent of the user decision on the prompt and recorded on form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.HomeAndWorkSupersetProfileDecision
histogram.summary: Logs the user's decision for saving a home/work profile superset. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.HomeOrWorkAndNameEmailMergeDecision
histogram.summary: Logs the user's decision for saving a merge of a home/work and a name email profile. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.InaccessibleFieldsRemoved.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: Logs that a given field type was removed on import, due to being setting inaccessible in the imported profile's country. Emitted on profile import.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.InaccessibleFieldsRemoved.Total
histogram.summary: Logs if at least one field was removed on import, due to being setting inaccessible in the imported profile's country. Emitted on profile import.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.MigrateProfileDecision
histogram.summary: Logs the user's decision for migrating a stored profile with record type AutofillProfile::RecordType::kLocalOrSyncable to the account storage. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.NameEmailSupersetProfileDecision
histogram.summary: Logs the user's decision for saving a name email profile superset. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.NewProfileDecision
histogram.summary: Obsolete metric, replaced by Autofill.ProfileImport.NewProfileDecision2. Logs the user's decision for storing a new address profile observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.NewProfileDecision2.{UserGroup}
histogram.summary: Logs the user's decision for storing a new address profile observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

variant.name: Aggregate
variant.summary: Aggregated data of all users.

variant.name: UserHasExistingProfile
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded for users who have address profiles saved already.

variant.name: UserHasNoExistingProfiles
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded for users who don't have any address profiles saved.

variant.name: UserHasQuasiDuplicateProfile
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded for users where an existing address profile matches the import candidate after removing one field.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.PhoneNumberParsed
histogram.summary: Logs if a phone number was parsed successfully on profile import. Only emitted when a number is present in the submitted form.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.ProfileImportType
histogram.summary: The type of an import of an address that is observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted once the import decision is final. This does not necessarily mean that the user was prompted.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.SilentUpdatesProfileImportType
histogram.summary: The type of an import of an address that is observed in a form submission when the form does not satisfy profile import requirements. This metric is emitted once the import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.SplitZipFields.NewProfileDecision
histogram.summary: Logs the user's decision for storing a new address profile extracted from a form with non-empty split zip code fields on form submission. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.StorageNewAddressIsSavedTo
histogram.summary: Logs in which storage type the new address profile will be stored when the user accepted the save prompt that was shown to them after a form submission. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.UpdateProfileAffectedType.{Decision}
histogram.summary: Logs that a specific type would have changed in a profile update process that received a specific {Decision}. The update was shown to the user because a profile similar to an already existing profile was observed in a form submission. Note that this metric collects the changed types before the user potentially applies additional edits. The metric is recorded on form submission once the user decision is final.

variant.name: Accepted
variant.summary: The user accepted the update flow from the initial prompt.

variant.name: Any
variant.summary: Any decision.

variant.name: AutoDeclined
variant.summary: The prompt is suppressed most likely because there is already another prompt shown on the same tab.

variant.name: Declined
variant.summary: The user declined the update flow from the initial prompt.

variant.name: EditAccepted
variant.summary: The user accepted the update flow from the edit dialog.

variant.name: EditDeclined
variant.summary: The user declined the update flow from the edit dialog.

variant.name: Ignored
variant.summary: The user ignored the prompt.

variant.name: MessageDeclined
variant.summary: The user swipes away the update Message. This is only relevant on mobile.

variant.name: MessageTimeout
variant.summary: The update message timed out before the user interacted. This is only relevant on mobile.

variant.name: Never
variant.summary: The user selected to never save a new profile on a given domain or update a specific profile (currently not supported).

variant.name: UserNotAsked
variant.summary: No prompt is shown and no decision is needed to proceed with the process.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.UpdateProfileDecision
histogram.summary: Obsolete metric, replaced by Autofill.ProfileImport.UpdateProfileDecision2. Logs the user's decision for editing an already existing address after a similar profile was observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.UpdateProfileDecision2.{UserGroup}
histogram.summary: Logs the user's decision for editing an already existing address after a similar profile was observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

variant.name: Aggregate
variant.summary: Aggregated data of all users.

variant.name: UserHasQuasiDuplicateProfile
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded for users where an existing address profile matches the import candidate after removing one field. The profile to be updated is not considered an existing profile in the calculation of the duplication rank.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.UpdateProfileNumberOfAffectedFields.{Decision}
histogram.summary: Logs the number of fields that would be changed by an accepted update for any possible Decision. Note that this metric collects the number of changed fields before the user potentially applies additional edits. The metric is recorded on form submission once the user decision is final.

variant.name: Accepted
variant.summary: The user accepted the update flow from the initial prompt.

variant.name: Any
variant.summary: Any decision.

variant.name: AutoDeclined
variant.summary: The prompt is suppressed most likely because there is already another prompt shown on the same tab.

variant.name: Declined
variant.summary: The user declined the update flow from the initial prompt.

variant.name: EditAccepted
variant.summary: The user accepted the update flow from the edit dialog.

variant.name: EditDeclined
variant.summary: The user declined the update flow from the edit dialog.

variant.name: Ignored
variant.summary: The user ignored the prompt.

variant.name: MessageDeclined
variant.summary: The user swipes away the update Message. This is only relevant on mobile.

variant.name: MessageTimeout
variant.summary: The update message timed out before the user interacted. This is only relevant on mobile.

variant.name: Never
variant.summary: The user selected to never save a new profile on a given domain or update a specific profile (currently not supported).

variant.name: UserNotAsked
variant.summary: No prompt is shown and no decision is needed to proceed with the process.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.{ImportType}EditedType

variant.name: HomeAndWorkSuperset
variant.summary: Logs that a specific type was edited in a home/work superset prompt.

variant.name: HomeWorkNameEmailMerge
variant.summary: Logs that a specific type was edited in a `kAccountNameEmail` and H/W superset prompt.

variant.name: MigrateProfile
variant.summary: Logs that a specific type was edited in a profile migration prompt.

variant.name: NameEmailSuperset
variant.summary: Logs that a specific type was edited in a `kAccountNameEmail` superset prompt.

variant.name: NewProfile
variant.summary: Logs that a specific type was edited in a new profile save prompt that was shown to the user when a new address profile is observed in a form submission.

variant.name: UpdateProfile
variant.summary: Logs that a specific type was edited in a profile update prompt that was shown to the user when a profile similar to an already existing profile was observed in a form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImportValidCandidate.ZipCode.Length
histogram.summary: Logs the zip code length. This metric is emitted during the import process, after the extracted profile has been validated and passed minimal address requirements, but before the final import decision.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImportValidCandidate.ZipCode.Separator
histogram.summary: Logs the specific separator character found in a zip code. This metric is emitted during the import process, after the extracted profile has been validated and passed minimal address requirements, but before the final import decision.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileTokenQuality.PerProfile
histogram.summary: The overall acceptance rate of all stored observations for the profile. Emitted once per profile at Chrome profile start-up.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileTokenQuality.StoredObservationsCount.PerProfile
histogram.summary: Records the total number of observations stored for a profile. Emitted once per profile at Chrome profile start-up.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileTokenQuality.StoredObservationTypes.{Type}
histogram.summary: Records which observation types are stored. Emitted once per profile and storable type at Chrome profile start-up. For additional supported types, consulte the metric of the corresponding storable type.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileTokenQuality.{Type}
histogram.summary: Records the acceptance rate of {Type}, based on the available observations for it. Emitted once per profile and storeable type at Chrome profile start-up. For additional supported types, consulte the metric of the corresponding storable type.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileTokenQualityScore
histogram.summary: Records the {number of observations (bits 0-3, capped at 10), quality score (bits 4-7), profile token (bits 8-15)} as a bitmask, if there were any observations. The score is an integer ranging from 0 to 10, as is the number of observations. Observations are from the profile that was used for filling. Emitted on form submission, after the profile's observations were updated.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProgressDialog.{FlowType}.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of the progress dialog, which can either be canceled (user canceled while it was in progress) or not canceled (user waited until confirmation). This dialog is shown in between other dialogs in a flow to provide a progress state to the user. If the user does not cancel it, after its related background task completes it moves on to the next dialog in the flow that it is a part of. The metric is recorded when this dialog is dismissed, and the result that gets logged is false if the user waited until confirmation or true if the user canceled the dialog.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProgressDialog.{FlowType}.Shown
histogram.summary: Records true every time the progress dialog is shown. This dialog is shown in between other dialogs in a payments autofill flow to provide a progress state to the user. If the user does not cancel it, after its related background task completes it moves on to the next dialog in the flow that it is a part of.

histogram.name: Autofill.PromptStatus
histogram.summary: Gives the status of the autofill prompts. Recorded when processing the submitted form data and only if there is enough data to display at least one prompt.

histogram.name: Autofill.QueriedCreditCardFormIsSecure
histogram.summary: For credit card forms that are queried for Autofill, a ratio of how many are within secure contexts (which includes mixed passive content).

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.BackoffDelay
histogram.summary: The delay of a network request for a query due to exponential backoff.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.FailingPayloadSize
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that were sent in a query that subsequently failed. This is to help determine the appropriate threshold at which autofill queries should switch from GET to POST, and if there are certain sizes of queries which are prone to failure.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.GetUrlLength
histogram.summary: The length of url of GET request sent to Autofill Server.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.HttpResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: The http response code or net error code returned on a query.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.Method
histogram.summary: The HTTP method used to query the autofill server.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.RequestDuration
histogram.summary: The duration of a network request for a query.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.RequestsInLastMinute
histogram.summary: The number of query requests sent to the Autofill server in a sliding 60-second window. This is recorded with every request that is not served from cache.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.WasInCache
histogram.summary: Was the autofill query response retrieved from the HTTP cache.

histogram.name: Autofill.Rationalization.OnlyFillWhenFocused.Quality
histogram.summary: Records whether the "only_fill_when_focused"-rationalization had a Good, Ok or Bad impact. Good means that the rationalization prevented the user from editing a field that would have been autofilled if the rationalization didn't happen. Ok means that the rationalization had no impact of whether the user edited the field or not. Bad means that the rationalization made the user edit a field (by either typing or triggering autofill a second time) that wouldn't have been edited if the rationalization didn't happen.

histogram.name: Autofill.Refill.ModifiedFieldsCount.{RefillTriggerReason}
histogram.summary: Records the number of fields that were modified by a single refill operation. This metric is emitted at each triggered refill operation.

histogram.name: Autofill.RefillTriggerReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason for triggering a refill operation after a filling operation. This metric is recording each time a refill is triggered.

histogram.name: Autofill.RendererFillSkipReason
histogram.summary: Logs the reason for skipping filling a field in the renderer. Emitted every time a field is passed to ShouldSkipFillField in form_autofill_util.cc.

histogram.name: Autofill.RendererLabeledAmountExtractionLatency.{RendererAmountExtractionLatencyResult}
histogram.summary:
Recorded after attempting to extract a labeled amount from a web page within the renderer process. This metric tracks the duration from the start of the `ExtractLabeledTextNodeValue` method to the end of the amount extraction operation inside the renderer process. It specifically measures the latency of the amount extraction process performed by the renderer, differentiating if the amount was successfully extracted or not.
The histogram `Autofill.RendererLabeledAmountExtractionLatency.Failure` records the latency when amount extraction fails and `Autofill.RendererLabeledAmountExtractionLatency.Success` records the latency when amount extraction succeeded. This metric aims to provide insight into the latency of the renderer-side amount extraction.

variant.name: Failure
variant.summary: Labeled amount extraction latency when amount extraction failed on renderer-side

variant.name: Success
variant.summary: Labeled amount extraction latency when amount extraction succeeded on renderer-side

histogram.name: Autofill.ResetAutofillPrefToChrome
histogram.summary: Clank only. Logs whether the user decided to use 3P password managers but a precondition prevented their use so Chrome fell back to using the built-in password manager. Emitted only once per cold start of Chrome when the first tab is created.

histogram.name: Autofill.RiskBasedAuth.{CardType}.Attempt
histogram.summary: Emits true when a risk-based authentication starts, and does not emit any value otherwise. Currently, ServerCard and VirtualCard support risk-based authentication.

histogram.name: Autofill.RiskBasedAuth.{CardType}.Latency
histogram.summary: Logs the roundtrip latency of the UnmaskCardRequest during risk-based authentication. It is logged when the UnmaskCardRequest is completed.

histogram.name: Autofill.RiskBasedAuth.{CardType}.Result
histogram.summary: Logs the result of a risk-based unmasking process when the unmasking is finished (whether it succeeded or the failure reason). Broken down by the type of card to be unmasked.

histogram.name: Autofill.RiskDataLoading.Latency
histogram.summary: Logs the latency of risk data loading. It is logged when the loading is completed or timed out.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveAndFill.CreateCard.Latency{RequestResult}
histogram.summary: Records the latency of the CreateCard request of the Save-and-Fill flow when {RequestResult}. Logged when the response of the request is received.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveAndFill.DialogResult
histogram.summary: Records the user's action in the Save and Fill dialog. Logged when the user accepts (with or without providing a CVC) or cancels the dialog.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveAndFill.DialogShown.{SaveType}
histogram.summary: Records when the Save and Fill dialog is shown, broken down by whether it is a local or upload save.

variant.name: Local
variant.summary: Local save

variant.name: Upload
variant.summary: Server save

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveAndFill.Funnel.{SaveType}.{Result}
histogram.summary: Records form events to calculate the Save and Fill conversion rate. Logged when the form is filled and when form is submitted. It has two breakdowns to indicate that the save is a {SaveType} and {Result}.

variant.name: Local
variant.summary: local save

variant.name: Upload
variant.summary: server save

variant.name: Failure
variant.summary: save failed

variant.name: Success
variant.summary: save succeeded

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveAndFill.GetDetailsForCreateCard.Latency{RequestResult}
histogram.summary: Records the latency of the GetDetailsForCreateCard request of the Save-and-Fill flow when {RequestResult}. Logged when the response of the request is received.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveAndFill.SuggestionNotShownReason
histogram.summary: Logged when the Save and Fill suggestion is not shown to the user, indicating the reason for it not being shown. Logged once per page load when the conditions for showing the suggestion are checked and not met.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCardCardholderNamePrefilled
histogram.summary: If the cardholder name fix flow is shown when credit card upload is offered, records if the cardholder name textfield was prefilled with the name from the user's Google Account.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCardCardholderNameWasEdited
histogram.summary: If the cardholder name fix flow is shown during credit card upload and the user accepts upload, logs whether the final cardholder name was changed from its prefilled value or not.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCardRequestExpirationDateReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason expiration date was explicitly requested from the user during credit card save.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptOffer.Android.Server.{ServerSaveSituation}
histogram.summary: Logs whether the save credit card prompt on android is shown or not shown for a card to be saved as a server card, which {ServerSaveSituation}. Is emitted whenever card save is offered or decision to not offer is made.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptOffer.Android.{SaveDestination}
histogram.summary: Logs whether the save credit card prompt on android is shown or not shown for a card to be saved as a {SaveDestination} card. Is emitted whenever card save is offered or decision to not offer is made.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptOffer.Android.{SaveDestination}.{SaveSituation}
histogram.summary: Logs whether the save credit card prompt on android is shown or not shown for a card to be saved as a {SaveDestination} card, when {SaveSituation}. Is emitted whenever card save is offered or decision to not offer is made.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptOffer.Desktop.Server.{ServerSaveSituation}
histogram.summary: Logs whether the save credit card prompt on desktop is shown or not shown for a card to be saved as a server card, which {ServerSaveSituation}. Is emitted whenever card save is offered or decision to not offer is made. Not logged for prompt re-shows (e.g., prompt reshown from the omnibox icon on desktop).

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptOffer.Desktop.{SaveDestination}
histogram.summary: Logs whether the save credit card prompt on desktop is shown or not shown for a card to be saved as a {SaveDestination} card. Is emitted whenever card save is offered or decision to not offer is made. Not logged for prompt re-shows (e.g., prompt reshown from the omnibox icon on desktop).

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptOffer.Desktop.{SaveDestination}.{SaveSituation}
histogram.summary: Logs whether the save credit card prompt on desktop is shown or not shown for a card to be saved as a {SaveDestination} card, when {SaveSituation}. Is emitted whenever card save is offered or decision to not offer is made. Not logged for prompt re-shows (e.g., prompt reshown from the omnibox icon on desktop).

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptOffer.IOS.{SaveDestination}.{OverlayType}.NumStrikes.{Strikes}.{FixFlow}{SaveCardWithCvcSituation}
histogram.summary: Logs whether the save credit card prompt of the type {OverlayType} on iOS is shown or not shown for a card to be saved as a {SaveDestination} card, with {Strikes} and which required {FixFlow}, and this card is {SaveCardWithCvcSituation}. Is emitted whenever card save is offered or decision to not offer is made.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptOffer.IOS.{SaveDestination}.{OverlayType}{SaveCardWithCvcSituation}
histogram.summary: Logs whether the save credit card prompt of the type {OverlayType} on iOS is shown or not shown for a card to be saved as a {SaveDestination} card, and this card is {SaveCardWithCvcSituation}. Is emitted whenever card save is offered or decision to not offer is made.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptOffer.{SaveDestination}
histogram.summary: Logs whether the save credit card prompt is shown or not shown for a card to be saved as a {SaveDestination} card. Is emitted whenever card save is offered or decision to not offer is made. Not logged for prompt re-shows (e.g., prompt reshown from the omnibox icon on desktop).

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptOffer.{SaveDestination}.{ShowType}{SaveType}
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which the Autofill save credit card prompt is shown or not to save a credit card {SaveDestination}, {SaveType}. Logged when the flow is triggered and the decision of whether or not to offer credit card save is made. It was a {ShowType}.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptResult.Desktop.Server.{ServerSaveSituation}
histogram.summary: Logs how the user interacts with the save credit card prompt for a card to be saved as a server card, which {ServerSaveSituation}. Is emitted as soon as user accepts or when the prompt closes. Not logged for prompt re-shows (e.g., prompt reshown from the omnibox icon).

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptResult.Desktop.{SaveDestination}
histogram.summary: Logs how the user interacts with the save credit card prompt for a card to be saved as a {SaveDestination} card. Is emitted as soon as user accepts or when the prompt closes. Not logged for prompt re-shows (e.g., prompt reshown from the omnibox icon on desktop).

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptResult.Desktop.{SaveDestination}.{SaveSituation}
histogram.summary: Logs how the user interacts with the save credit card prompt for a card to be saved as a {SaveDestination} card, when {SaveSituation}. Is emitted as soon as user accepts or when the prompt closes. Not logged for prompt re-shows (e.g., prompt reshown from the omnibox icon on desktop).

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptResult.Desktop.{SaveDestination}.{UserGroup}
histogram.summary: Logs how the user interacts with the save credit card prompt for a card to be saved as a {SaveDestination} card, with {UserGroup}. Is emitted as soon as user accepts or when the prompt closes. Not logged for prompt re-shows (e.g., prompt reshown from the omnibox icon on desktop).

variant.name: UserHasNoCards
variant.summary: data aggregated across users who don't have credit cards saved

variant.name: UserHasSavedCards
variant.summary: data aggregated across users who have credit cards saved already.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptResult.IOS.{SaveDestination}.{OverlayType}.NumStrikes.{Strikes}.{FixFlow}{SaveType}
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which the credit card prompt on iOS of the type {OverlayType} is shown and user's subsequent action (accepted, denied or ignored) taken for that prompt for a card to be saved as a {SaveDestination} card with {Strikes} and which required {FixFlow}. The prompt is shown when {SaveType}. Is emitted every time the prompt is shown or not shown and for any action taken when shown.
